Job Description:
About the job
About Bree
Bree is a consumer finance platform that brings better, faster, and cheaper financial services to over half the Canadian population who live paycheck to paycheck. We operate in a huge, but overlooked market in a country with the least amount of financial technology innovation in the developed world. Our first act is to become the cheapest and best provider of short-term credit to the 20 million people in Canada who live paycheck to paycheck.
More than 600,000 Canadians have already signed up with Bree and we believe we are just scratching the surface. We are in an exciting place where we have product market fit, explosive growth, and a clear path to becoming one of the most important FinTechs in Canada.
We are at 8-figures of annualized revenue, growing double-digit monthly, profitable, and have had zero voluntary employee churn. We were part of Y Combinator in 2021 and raised a $2M seed round shortly after.
About The Role
We're looking for a Software Engineer, Backend to architect and evolve our serverless infrastructure while leveraging cutting-edge AI development tools. The ideal candidate combines deep backend expertise with a passion for building clean, maintainable systems and a forward-thinking approach to AI-assisted development.
What You'll Do
Lead the architectural evolution of our serverless backend systems, focusing on scalability, maintainability, and developer experience.
Refactor and modernize our existing Lambda-based microservices architecture to establish patterns that maximize AI tool effectiveness.
Design and implement robust data pipelines and payment processing systems across multiple providers.
Champion best practices for AI-native development, creating patterns and abstractions that enable rapid iteration with tools like Cursor and Claude Code.
Collaborate with infrastructure engineers to optimize our AWS-based architecture using Infrastructure as Code.
Drive the consolidation and standardization of our data layer across Supabase, Firebase, and legacy systems.
What You'll Need
Expert-level proficiency in TypeScript/Node.js and serverless architectures, with deep AWS Lambda and event-driven systems experience.
Proven track record of architecting and refactoring complex distributed systems at scale.
Strong experience with Infrastructure as Code, preferably Pulumi or similar tools, and AWS services (Step Functions, SQS, EventBridge).
Demonstrated ability to leverage AI development tools to accelerate delivery while maintaining code quality and architectural integrity.
Excellence in designing clean, testable, and well-documented code that serves as an effective context for AI assistants.
Commitment to Bree's mission of providing Canadian consumers with the best short-term credit services.

Comprehensive dental / vision

About the job
We are seeking an accomplished Principal Staff Backend Engineer to lead the design and development of scalable, secure, and resilient enterprise systems. You will set technical direction, mentor engineers, and architect platforms that power mission-critical products. This is a hands-on leadership role that spans cloud infrastructure, distributed systems, data platforms, and AI integration.
What You Will Do
Architect and Design: Define large scale distributed architectures for reliability, scalability, and performance.
Technical Leadership: Drive engineering standards, code quality, and operational excellence while mentoring senior engineers.
Modern Services: Build and optimize microservices, APIs, and data pipelines using current enterprise technologies.
Enterprise Delivery: Meet strict security, compliance, and performance requirements for global customers.
Innovation: Evaluate and adopt emerging technologies where they add measurable value.
Core Languages
Expert in at least one of Python, Java, or C++
Bonus: Go, Rust, or Scala
Cloud and Infrastructure
Cloud: AWS, Azure, or GCP (multi-cloud experience is a plus)
Containers and Orchestration: Docker, Kubernetes
Infrastructure as Code: Terraform, Pulumi, CloudFormation
Serverless: AWS Lambda, Google Cloud Functions, Azure Functions
Networking and Service Mesh: Istio, Linkerd, Envoy, NGINX
CI/CD: GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Argo CD, Jenkins, Spinnaker
APIs and Services
API Styles: REST, GraphQL, gRPC
Architectures: Microservices, event-driven, CQRS, Saga patterns
Gateway and Management: Kong, Apigee, AWS API Gateway, NGINX
Data and Streaming
Databases: PostgreSQL, MySQL, Oracle
NoSQL and Caching: DynamoDB, Cassandra, MongoDB, Redis, Memcached
Streaming and Batch: Kafka, Pulsar, Spark, Flink, Airflow, dbt
Analytics and Warehousing: Snowflake, BigQuery, Redshift, Databricks
Search and Indexing: Elasticsearch, OpenSearch, Solr
Object Storage and Lakehouse: S3, GCS, ADLS, Delta Lake, Iceberg, Hudi
AI and Advanced Capabilities
ML Frameworks and Serving: TensorFlow, PyTorch, ONNX Runtime, Triton Inference Server
Feature Stores and Pipelines: Feast, Kubeflow, MLflow
AI Systems Integration: Vector DBs (Pinecone, Milvus, Weaviate), RAG patterns, embeddings
Security and Compliance
Auth and Identity: OAuth2, OIDC, SAML, JWT
Secrets and KMS: HashiCorp Vault, AWS KMS, Azure Key Vault, GCP KMS
Compliance Awareness: SOC 2, ISO 27001, HIPAA, PCI DSS
AppSec: SAST, DAST, dependency scanning, SBOM
Reliability and Observability
Monitoring and Tracing: Prometheus, Grafana, OpenTelemetry, Jaeger, ELK/EFK
Resilience: Circuit breakers, rate limiting, backoff, bulkheads, chaos engineering
Performance: Profiling, load testing, capacity planning, autoscaling
Qualifications
10+ years of backend engineering experience including 3+ years at Staff or Principal level
Proven success designing and operating distributed systems at scale
Strong skills in algorithms, data structures, concurrency, and performance tuning
Experience leading architecture reviews and influencing large engineering teams
Clear communication with executives, product, security, and cross-functional partners
Why Join
You will shape platform strategy, mentor engineers, and build systems that billions can rely on. You will work with state of the art enterprise technology to solve high impact backend challenges.

About the job
Questrade Financial Group (QFG), through its companies - Questrade, Inc., Questrade Wealth Management Inc., Community Trust Company, Zolo, and Flexiti Financial Inc., provides securities and foreign currency investment, professionally managed investment portfolios, mortgages, real estate services, financial services and more. Questrade uses cutting-edge technologies to develop innovative products that give customers better, more affordable ways to take control of their money.
We are everything a traditional financial institution is not. At QFG, you will be constantly moving forward, bringing the future of fintech into existence. You will be a part of a collaborative team that cares deeply about our mission and each other. Your team members will help you conquer challenges, push boundaries and discover what you are truly capable of.
At QFG, we have a culture of innovation where technology serves people—both our team and our customers. We see AI as a collaborative and transformative enabler, and we are seeking forward-thinking individuals who can effectively integrate it into their daily work. The ideal candidate will be a catalyst for change, helping us use AI to create a more efficient and rewarding employee experience while also developing cutting-edge solutions that delight and serve our customers. Join us in shaping a future where AI empowers our team to do their best work and helps us deliver unparalleled customer experiences.
This is a place where you can explore, discover and learn with continuous growth. As a diverse and inclusive place to work, with a hybrid working environment you can unleash your creativity and curiosity with no limits. If you share the same sense of infinite possibility, come shape your future at QFG.
What’s in it for you as an employee of QFG?
Health & wellbeing resources and programs 
Paid vacation, personal, and sick days for work-life balance 
Competitive compensation and benefits packages 
Work-life balance in a hybrid environment with at least 3 days in office 
Career growth and development opportunities 
Opportunities to contribute to community causes 
Work with diverse team members in an inclusive and collaborative environment 
We’re looking for our next Senior Manager, Software Engineering. Could It Be You?
We are on a mission to democratize finance and empower investors through technology. As part of the Brokerage Technology group, you won’t just be managing code; you will be building the foundational infrastructure that powers our internal efficiency and customer service excellence. We operate at the intersection of high-stakes finance and cutting-edge operational tech, delivering best-in-class applications that allow our internal teams to serve investors with speed and confidence.
We are seeking a strategic and forward-thinking Senior Manager, Software Engineering to lead a complex technology transformation. In this role, you will move beyond day-to-day coding to oversee the engineering members of multiple squads, focusing on high-impact modernization, cross-squad dependencies, and the integration of AI/ML capabilities.
The ideal candidate is an active thought leader who works closely with Product Management, Operations Leaders, and other key stakeholders to deliver robust, scalable systems. You will articulate the business value of technical debt reduction, drive architectural decisions (specifically Monolith to Microservices), and champion talent development, serving as a bridge between technical strategy and business mission.
Need more details? Keep reading…
In this role, responsibilities include but are not limited to:
People & Culture Leadership
Team Leadership: Strategically lead and manage the engineering team, fostering a culture of technical excellence, accountability, and psychological safety. 
Talent Development: Establish career development frameworks for the department, identifying high-potential individuals and creating specific growth opportunities, with a focus on upskilling the team in distributed systems and cloud practices. 
Coaching: Act as a hands-on technical coach to Team Leads and Engineers, championing initiatives to enhance engineering culture and promoting modern engineering practices. 
Vision & Motivation: Paint an engaging picture of future possibilities for the team, inspiring and motivating engineers through the transition from legacy systems to a modern, AI-enabled architecture. 
Change Management: Provide steady leadership during complex transitions, proactively managing stakeholder expectations and addressing resistance to ensure alignment across operational departments.
Technical Strategy & Architecture
Monolith Migration: Lead the multi-year strategy and execution plan for migrating the monolithic application to a resilient microservices and micro-frontend architecture. 
Data Strategy: Drive the strategic decoupling and breakdown of centralized databases into domain-bound databases to improve scalability, reliability, and service autonomy. 
AI/ML Integration: Establish the engineering pipeline (MLOps) and practices necessary to integrate ML/AI agents for process automation, directly contributing to reductions in customer service calls (CSS). 
Strategic Alignment: Ensure technology initiatives align with the broader Tech Strategy and serve as a competitive business edge by improving operational efficiency. 
Architectural Governance: Partner with Directors to make significant cross-team technical choices, defining high-level architecture and approving design patterns for broader systems.
Delivery & Operational Excellence
Product & Operations Partnership: Act as a key technical voice in the "product trio" (Product, Design, Engineering), ensuring technical feasibility and innovation align with user experience goals and operational SLAs. 
Value Articulation: Articulate the value of technology initiatives (specifically modernization and AI adoption) to stakeholders at all levels, persuasively rallying support and tailoring communication to win buy-in. 
Lifecycle Management: Lead development initiatives from initial bootstrap and prototyping phases through to production launch, specifically managing the roadmap to balance feature delivery with essential technical debt reduction. 
Reliability & Performance: Oversee the management and optimization of critical operational applications, ensuring high availability, system Uptime/SLA compliance, and scalability under heavy load. 
Process Optimization: Oversee the development and optimization of department-wide processes, ensuring they incorporate evolving governance best practices, IT policies, and MLOps principles.
So are YOU our next Senior Manager, Software Engineering? You are if you…
Education & Experience
Minimum 7+ years of progressive experience in web-based technologies and Software Engineering. 
Minimum 3+ years in people management, specifically managing high-performing teams. 
Degree, diploma, or equivalent directly related work experience in Computer Science or Engineering. 
Proven track record leading major architectural migrations (e.g., Monolith to Microservices) in a high-volume, production environment is required. 
Experience in enterprise-grade solutioning and digital financial services is highly preferred.
Technical Proficiency
Extensive experience in Cloud native development of Microservices , specifically using Google Kubernetes Engine (GKE) and other Google Cloud Platform components. 
Strong knowledge of front-end frameworks such as Angular and React Native, with specific expertise in overseeing Micro-front-end architecture. 
Familiarity with diverse data storage solutions including Google Cloud SQL, MongoDB, Redis Cache, and SQL Server. 
Understanding of event streaming and messaging architectures using Google Pub/Sub and Kafka. 
Proficiency with modern CI/CD pipelines and collaboration tools such as Gitlab, Jira, and Confluence. 
Understanding of MLOps principles and experience establishing engineering pipelines for AI/ML integration. 
Strong skills in application performance tuning and optimization.
Leadership & Strategic Capabilities
Advanced ability to identify potential stakeholders, analyze expectations, and work independently to manage relationships across the organization. 
Excellent interpersonal skills with the ability to remain calm under pressure and coach teams through change and ambiguity. 
Expertise in the full software development life cycle (SDLC), including design, configuration, integration, testing, quality assurance, and post-production support. 
Strong skills in risk mitigation and ensuring the scalability and maintainability of complex systems. 
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, capable of translating technical concepts for business audiences.

Job Title: Sr. Software Engineer - AI Tech Leader
Job Description:
About the job
Software Engineer V – Global Scale Systems
The Challenge
Billions of people rely on our systems every day — to connect, to create, to work, to play. Each millisecond of latency matters. Each system outage ripples across the globe. As a Software Engineer V, you won’t just write code — you’ll design the architecture that keeps the digital world moving at scale.
What Success Looks Like
You architect services that survive failures, scale automatically, and process traffic measured in millions of requests per second.
You mentor senior engineers, helping them see the tradeoffs between “works now” and “lasts a decade.”
You influence product strategy by turning ambiguous problems into elegant technical solutions.
You balance speed and rigor — delivering features while safeguarding reliability and security.
You are a trusted voice in design reviews, known for spotting both the hidden risks and the hidden opportunities.
Your Toolkit
We Don’t Expect You To Know Everything. But To Thrive Here, You’ll Need Deep Expertise In One Or More Modern Languages (Python, Java, C++, Go) And The Ability To Quickly Learn New Ones. You Should Feel At Home In
Distributed systems and microservice architectures
Cloud-scale infrastructure (AWS, GCP, or Azure)
Databases at scale — relational, NoSQL, in-memory caches
Performance tuning, observability, and debugging in complex environments
Security best practices for global, user-facing systems
The Impact
As an Engineer V, the systems you design will form the backbone of products used by billions. From video streaming to real-time AI, your work will enable experiences that people around the world consider essential.
Who Thrives Here
This isn’t a role for those who want to simply maintain systems. It’s for engineers who thrive on complexity, who see ambiguity as an opportunity, and who are motivated by the idea that their work could shape the future of global technology.
Why Join
You’ll work with some of the best engineers in the world, on problems that matter, with the freedom to experiment and the responsibility to deliver at scale.
If you want to push the boundaries of what’s possible in software engineering, this is the place to do it.

Job Title: Vice President of Product Engineering, 2 Hour Learning (Remote) - $400,000/year USD
Job Description:
About the job
This role is for a technical product leader prepared to drive the reinvention of education through AI. 2 Hour Learning seeks an architect with the depth to lead the modernization of our AI-powered learning ecosystem. You will need the technical expertise to function as a CTO, the strategic vision to catalyze transformational change, and the commitment to deploy these capabilities to unlock student potential at scale.
While most organizations add AI to conventional education systems as a superficial enhancement, 2 Hour Learning has pursued a fundamentally different approach: we have reconstructed the entire school model, leveraging AI and learning science to eliminate the limitations of the traditional classroom. Our students don't merely progress — they excel, earning multiple 4s and 5s on AP exams, demonstrating multi-year academic advancement within a single year, and regularly surpassing their own projected outcomes. We have validated that when AI serves as the foundational operating system for learning, student performance accelerates dramatically.
This is not a conventional product management position centered on customer feedback cycles or gradual feature rollouts. This is an executive-level technical product ownership role in which you will control the architecture, technical roadmap, and AI integration across our complete learning platform. You will make the difficult technical trade-offs necessary to keep our products lean, scalable, and relentlessly oriented toward student outcome improvement. You will think with the rigor of a CTO while executing with the agility of a product entrepreneur, fusing engineering discipline with learning science principles to drive continuous innovation.
If you are prepared to lead the technical transformation of education and possess the operational discipline to support that vision, we invite your application. This is your chance to shape the future of learning.
What You Will Be Doing
Sustaining and demonstrating comprehensive education product expertise to inform strategic decisions
Creating technical specifications that resolve critical technical decisions and emphasize simplicity, efficiency, and long-term sustainability
Deploying generative AI technologies to automate and optimize engineering workflows, consistent with the strategic objective of minimizing manual effort
What You Won’t Be Doing
Pure people management; this position demands your business judgment and technical expertise as primary drivers
Spending time on meetings, committees, and administrative overhead; we have automated management burdens to enable focus on delivering business value through direct contribution
High-level strategic recommendations without actionable implementation guidance; your proposals must be grounded in product-level detail
Vice President Of Product Engineering Key Responsibilities
Serve as the CTO for one or more education products, owning core technical competencies and generating business value through flawless execution and strategic leadership
Basic Requirements
Substantial experience or demonstrated interest in data-driven learning science
7+ years of experience making critical architecture and design decisions on software projects, including the application of architecture design patterns or major open source technologies
2+ years of experience making design decisions that involve cloud computing services (primarily AWS)
4+ years of experience in roles with complete technical and delivery ownership of a revenue-generating product
Experience developing product features that leverage advanced use of Generative AI
Experience applying Generative AI to streamline work processes
About 2 Hour Learning
Education is broken, but 2 Hour Learning is proving it doesn’t have to be. They’re tearing down the outdated one-size-fits-all model and replacing it with AI-driven personalized learning that helps kids master academics in just two hours a day.
With students consistently ranking in the top 1-2% nationally and the top 20% achieving an astonishing 6.5x growth, they’re proving that smarter learning is possible. At 2 Hour Learning, it’s talent and performance that matter. 
They offer a dynamic, on-campus and remote-friendly environment where innovators, educators, and AI specialists can be a part of fixing a broken school system.
2 Hour Learning is reprogramming learning for the AI era.
Here’s How They’re Fixing It.
There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
Working with us
This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover as a Contractor of Record. The compensation level for this role is $200 USD/hour, which equates to $400,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.

Job Description:
Department Overview
Within Business Banking, the Fund My Business (FMB) Journey is focused on delivering competitive
lending solutions with speed and simplicity to meet the evolving credit needs of our customers. By
aligning technology, process, policies, and customer experience, Fund My Business aims to elevate both
colleague and client interactions while enabling seamless credit monitoring, decisioning, and operational efficiency. The Leverage Data as a Strategic Asset team uses predictive models and analytics that generate insights leading to process efficiency and enhanced risk management.
Job Description
Are you excited about the opportunity to improve the customer and colleague experience by delivering
value faster across the credit process? Are you interested in data analytics and learning how data can be transformed into actionable insights to improve process speed, consistency and accuracy?
Working closely with cross-functional teams, this role will support planning, managing,
and executing on the end-to-end delivery and management of data and analytics programs with the objective of delivering value faster across all segments and reducing the overall effort across the credit journey, while maintaining sound risk management and compliance.
Accountabilities
Lead and support discovery, planning, business casing, and delivery of analytics and automation that simplify branch work, enhance efficiency, and improve the credit journey.
Facilitate and lead cross‑functional working sessions, driving alignment and momentum on assigned initiatives.
Collaborate across business segments to expand the use of data and analytics, improving process effectiveness and decision quality.
Develop reporting and insights that enable program monitoring, strengthen understanding, and inform continuous improvement.
Serve as a subject matter expert on Business Banking credit products, processes, and policies, with emphasis on Commercial Credit.
Act as business lead or support for model monitoring attestations, annual reviews, validations, and recalibrations to ensure model performance and compliance.
Champion analytics change and adoption, working closely with Communications and Change Management to ensure impacts are well understood, managed, and communicated.
Integrate data‑driven insights into business processes, colleague tools, and customer engagement strategies.
Drive strong cross‑functional partnership to secure buy‑in and ensure successful implementation of analytics initiatives.
Identify and escalate key issues to appropriate stakeholders in a timely and transparent manner.
Promote a culture of strong risk management and control, aligned to TD’s risk appetite and operational standards.
Contribute to a positive, high‑performing team environment, sharing knowledge, best practices, and supporting peer development.
Required Skills
Strong interpersonal, communication, and stakeholder‑management skills.
Demonstrated business acumen with the ability to identify where data and analytics can unlock efficiency, innovation, and value.
Strong math and statistics capability with the ability to understand and navigate complex processes.
Ability to translate technical insights into clear, actionable narratives for business stakeholders.
Advanced communication and storytelling skills to simplify complex data for non‑technical audiences.
Developing leadership capabilities with the ability to work effectively across all organizational levels.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting, business casing, and influencing senior leaders.
Ability to perform data analysis, synthesize insights, and present strategic recommendations.
Preferred: Small Business or Commercial Banking experience.
Preferred: Project management experience.
Experience & Education
3+ years of experience in Business Banking; experience in Commercial Credit is considered an asset.
Undergraduate degree in Business, Data Science, Analytics, Economics, Engineering, or related discipline; graduate degree or relevant certifications considered an asset.
Strong influencing skills with proven ability to make recommendations and engage stakeholders to achieve business objectives.
Strategic mindset with the ability to recommend and assess end‑to‑end process improvements.
Excellent facilitation, presentation, and negotiation skills.
Self‑starter with strong initiative, ability to work independently, and exceptional attention to detail.
Ability to connect initiatives to objectives and key results and support outcome‑driven execution.
Who We Are:
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.
Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn more
Additional Information:
We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD – and we’re committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.
Training & Onboarding
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.
Interview Process

Accommodation

We look forward to hearing from you!

Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. Salary: Please note the base salary range for this position is CDN $170,000.00 to CDN $185,000.00
Job Description:
About the job
Join a pioneering team shaping the future of Canadian Retail Credit Strategies.
We’re building next-generation, end-to-end credit solutions that span the entire lifecycle—from acquisition and account management to collections—anchored in a holistic Lending Decision Strategy and aligned with Canadian Personal & Business Banking (P&BB) priorities.
Our approach combines cutting-edge decisioning software, advanced decision trees, and innovative credit models to deliver smarter, faster, and more customer-centric outcomes. This is your opportunity to influence credit cycles using modern modeling techniques and best-in-class decisioning applications, all within a high-performance, customer-focused environment.
If you’re passionate about leveraging data, technology, and strategy to transform lending decisions and drive meaningful impact across Canadian P&BB, this is the team for you.
Develops and maintains risk decision-support strategies using analytical solutions to enable high-quality, fact-based decisions for a designated risk portfolio. Supports the development of the strategy and roadmap for data quality, data analytics, data modeling, reporting, business intelligence, and the design and development of sophisticated decision support tools.
Leads the development of the First Party Fraud (FPF) strategies across all retail credit product suites (i.e. Unsecured Lending, Real Estate Secured Lending or Business Banking) subject to 2LOD oversight, review and effective challenge, to mitigate losses across CDN P&BB clients and optimize risk-return outcomes within prescribed Board approved risk appetite. Collaborates with the retail product credit strategy leads to proactively manage the customer lifecycle (i.e. acquisition, account management, collections) and streamline products and processes to improve customer experience, fraud prevention effectiveness, and efficiencies while minimizing losses. Supports the execution and ongoing success of FPF strategies to optimize prevention, leveraging the enterprise fraud COE. Monitors, and calibrates early warning signals to ensure early indications of elevated risk are proactively identified and actioned.
Develops, monitors, and optimizes FPF strategies, tools and capabilities to mitigate first party fraud losses and implement controls and strategies to minimize the onboarding of high-risk customers while optimizing the customer experience and lifecycle journey
Analyzes information from Enterprise Fraud Management (EFM) to identify early warning signs of first party fraud and proactively address vulnerabilities.
Creates and maintains a comprehensive, clear, and socialized Fraud taxonomy and clear tagging criteria to drive insights and improve fraud reporting, prevention and detection.
Ensures changes to taxonomy and definitions are effectively managed and evolving, with 2nd line oversight, review and effective challenge.
Obtains clear input from retail credit product suite leads and coordinates with the EFM team on vendors and tech used to effectively mitigate first party fraud.
Identifies first party fraud vectors and types through analysis of emerging trends, to support to support first party fraud identification tagging and methodology for risk identification.
Provides first party fraud risk assessment and acceptance for current and new processes / products to ensure risks are mitigated to acceptable standards as defined by P&BB’s approved risk appetite.
Leads first party fraud risk mitigation strategy for current and new products submitting recommendations to 2nd line for oversight, review and effective challenge.
Incorporates first party fraud prevention learnings throughout P&BB credit ecosystem ensuring learnings from past strategies and monitoring incorporated into go-forward proposals.
Develops accurate credit proposals (incl. revenue and loss forecasts) and supports policy change proposals, using statistical models developed by 2nd line Modeling team and other analytical methods / tools to mitigate first party fraud losses.
Within the mandate of this role, promotes and supports the Bank’s risk culture including ensuring employees understand their accountabilities for risk-taking activities, promoting an environment of open communication and effective challenge, and establishing the “tone from the top” through leading by example.
Complies with the Bank’s Risk Appetite framework and ensures risk-taking activities remain within agreed limits and comply with all regulatory requirements.
Role models driving simplicity and productivity enhancements for optimization across groups driving continuous improvement on key measures.
Activates our winning culture, aligned with Purpose. Ignites engagement by aligning our culture to our strategy and fueling exceptional execution.
Fosters an inclusive environment for all employees by eliminating barriers to inclusion.
Develops leaders, plans for succession, and fosters a high-performance culture.
Drives top talent acquisition and retention, developing organizational capabilities to drive competitive advantage.
Leads and mentors a team with diverse risk and business experience, skills, and orientation.
Leads, promotes, and reinforces the Bank’s Ambition; personally, role models One Bank leadership; drives sustainable improvements in customer loyalty and business growth; adheres and supports enterprise customer experience and brand standards.
Qualifications:
Post secondary education or equivalent work experience
10+ years Financial Services experience preferably in a credit related area
Fraud prevention and analytical skills to assess risk in strategy development
Understanding of modelling, advanced analytics, and data analytics
Experience in stress testing
Strong quantitative/analytical skills
Advanced knowledge of Fraud Policies and processes
Thorough knowledge of the Bank Lending Process training tools and qualification process
In-depth knowledge of fraud management, processes, and reporting techniques
Familiarity with U.S. and Canadian regulations relating to FPF prevention
Ability to influence others in terms of FPF fraud strategy and direction.
Ability to network and establish industry relationships.
#FutureOfRetailLending

About the job
Ready to make your next big professional move? Join us on our journey to achieve our big dream of building the most loved restaurant brands in the world. 
Restaurant Brands International Inc. is one of the world's largest quick service restaurant companies with nearly $45 billion in annual system-wide sales and over 32,000 restaurants in more than 120 countries and territories.
RBI owns four of the world's most prominent and iconic quick service restaurant brands – TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES®, and FIREHOUSE SUBS®. These independently operated brands have been serving their respective guests, franchisees and communities for decades. Through its Restaurant Brands for Good framework, RBI is improving sustainable outcomes related to its food, the planet, and people and communities.
RBI is committed to growing the TIM HORTONS®, BURGER KING®, POPEYES® and FIREHOUSE SUBS® brands by leveraging their respective core values, employee and franchisee relationships, and long track records of community support. Each brand benefits from the global scale and shared best practices that come from ownership by Restaurant Brands International Inc.
We’re looking for a Sr. Manager, People Analytics to elevate RBI’s talent strategy through data-driven insights, executive storytelling, and enterprise-scale analytics solutions. This role will lead high-impact analytics projects, scale self-service infrastructure, and deliver actionable workforce insights to senior HR and business leaders.
You’ll manage a growing team of two direct reports and play a key role in advancing a data-first culture across the People function. You’ll partner closely with HR Tech, Talent, and business leaders to design and execute initiatives across the full employee lifecycle, including talent acquisition, mobility, performance, engagement, and retention.
A key part of this role is identifying where AI tools can help improve reporting, insights, and day-to-day work. You don’t need to be an AI engineer, but you should be comfortable evaluating how tools like ChatGPT or One Model’s AI Assistant can support our processes and help bring those ideas to life.
A key part of this role is helping the People Analytics space understand and apply AI in practical ways. You’ll introduce and scale AI methods that improve the quality of insights, expand automation, and support better decision-making across RBI. Proficiency in Python is required, as you'll work hands-on to automate and scale analytics tools. Experience with Workday Report Writer is strongly preferred.
RBI follows a 5 day, in-office work schedule to support collaboration. Candidates should be comfortable working onsite 5 days per week out of our office in Toronto, ON or Miami, FL.
Role And Responsibilities
Lead end-to-end people analytics projects - from intake and scoping to delivery - across dashboards, KPIs, predictive models, and ad-hoc insights
Spot opportunities where AI tools can improve analytics, reporting, or workflow efficiency, and help design solutions with the team
Define and maintain core talent metrics, aligning with HR and business priorities to support data-driven decision-making
Deliver executive- and board-level presentations and materials to support strategic workforce planning
Manage and coach a Sr. Analyst and Analyst, developing technical skills, business acumen, and insight fluency
Design and scale self-service tools and dashboards (e.g., One Model), ensuring usability and data quality across functions
Oversee Workday reporting, including calculated fields, and collaborate with HR Tech on reporting enhancements and governance
Build and automate reporting workflows using Python and SQL; support data pipelines and large-scale HR data transformation
Translate complex analytics into clear, actionable narratives that address the “so what” and “now what” for stakeholders
Establish intake and prioritization processes to manage cross-functional reporting needs effectively
Continuously improve data quality and infrastructure across systems to support enterprise analytics
Lead delivery of regulatory reports, SOX controls, and standard People reports with consistency and accuracy
Qualifications And Skills
6+ years of experience in People Analytics, Workforce Planning, HR Strategy, or a related analytics field
Bachelor's degree in Business, Statistics, HR Analytics, or related field
Advanced proficiency in Python (automation, modeling, transformation); SQL experience a plus
Strong expertise in Workday Report Writer; familiarity with One Model, Power BI, or similar tools
Experience creating and scaling KPI frameworks, self-service tools, and dashboards for HR and business partners
Familiarity with AI tools like ChatGPT or other generative AI assistants, and the ability to apply them to solve real HR and analytics challenges
Proven ability to coach and manage analytics talent, including analysts and junior team members
Excellent storytelling and data visualization skills - can translate insights into action for senior audiences
Highly organized, detail-oriented, and proactive in managing multiple high-priority projects
Comfortable navigating ambiguity and leading through change in a fast-paced, high-growth environment
Why Join Us?
You’ll help HR and business leaders understand the trends that matter - what drives turnover, how to improve hiring funnels, and how to strengthen engagement - by building clean dashboards, accurate KPIs, and insights supported by practical AI tools.

Salary: The salary range for this position is $175,000 - $205,000.
Job Description:
About the job
This role is eligible for our hybrid work model: Two days a week in-office.
We’re a data-driven organization, which makes our Pricing, Analytics and Data Science teams the brains of our operation. On the cutting edge of customer and business analytics, they make sure all our decisions and innovations are based on the latest insights.
Why This Job’s a Big Deal
Priceline is seeking a Director, Strategic Pricing and Analytics for our Accommodations business unit. This role will be responsible for executing and improving upon priceline's strategy for pricing and travel deal making.
Our mission is to deliver the best travel deals available to our customers. This role is central for us to fulfill this mission.
The ideal candidate for this role has prior pricing experience in an e-commerce or retail environment, with travel industry experience strongly preferred, and strong analytical skills with an excellent track record of execution.
In This Role You Will Get To
Lead a lean team of Senior Pricing Analysts to both execute and improve upon Priceline's strategy for pricing & competitive intelligence. 
Partner with other pricing team leaders, as well as those within our Technology, Product and Data Science Teams to develop innovative solutions and techniques to ensure Priceline's pricing remains competitive and profitable.
Strategize with the Sales and Competitive Intelligence Teams on ways we can be most competitive in the travel space.
Partner with Marketing and Finance Teams to ensure our operating margins stay intact and paid demand channel ROIs are stable. 
Maintain a steady cadence of designing and implementing A/B experiments that measure our customers’ price sensitivity and analyze results.
Identify appropriate reports to support decision making, recommend and build enhancements to our pricing reporting infrastructure.
Influence and challenge decisions made by the team through timely & insightful analysis and modeling.
Who You Are
You bring strong analytical, statistical, and problem-solving skills.
You’re comfortable partnering closely with Data Scientists and can speak their language, while also bringing strong commercial acumen and an understanding of how the business operates.
You have hands-on SQL experience, ideally with BigQuery or another relational database.
You’ve built, enhanced, and maintained reports and dashboards using Tableau and/or Excel.
You have experience working with Python (strongly preferred).
You’ve applied modeling techniques and analytical methods to real business problems.
You have a “can-do” mindset and a passion for analytics and data.
You have strong communication skills, both written and oral. 
You take responsibility for your results, truly “owning” your critical role.
You hold a Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, or a related field with at least 10 years of experience in analytics, consulting, or technology; or an MBA or Master’s degree with at least 6 years of relevant experience.
Experience in data science, market research, travel, and e-commerce is highly desirable. 
Illustrated history of living the values necessary to Priceline: Customer, Innovation, Team, Accountability and Trust. 
The Right Results, the Right Way is not just a motto at Priceline; it’s a way of life. It’s therefore essential that you also meet our high standard of ethics, honesty, transparency and compliance.
There are a variety of factors that go into determining a salary range, including but not limited to external market benchmark data, geographic location, and years of experience sought/required. In addition to a competitive base salary, certain roles may be eligible for an annual bonus and/or equity grant.
The salary range for this position is $175,000 - $205,000.
Who We Are
WE ARE PRICELINE.
Our success as one of the biggest players in online travel is all thanks to our incredible, dedicated team of talented employees. Priceliners are focused on being the best travel deal makers in the world, motivated by our passion to help everyone experience the moments that matter most in their lives. Whether it’s a dream vacation, your cousin’s graduation, or your best friend’s wedding - we make travel affordable and accessible to our customers.
Our culture is unique and inspiring (that’s what our employees tell us). We’re a grown-up, startup. We deliver the excitement of a new venture, without the struggles and chaos that can come with a business that hasn’t stabilized.
We’re on the cutting edge of innovative technologies. We keep the customer at the center of all that we do. Our ability to meet their needs relies on the strength of a workforce as diverse as the customers we serve. We bring together employees from all walks of life and we are proud to provide the kind of inclusive environment that stimulates innovation, creativity and collaboration.
Priceline is part of the Booking Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: BKNG) family of companies, a highly profitable global online travel company with a market capitalization of over $80 billion. Our sister companies include Booking.com, BookingGo, Agoda, Kayak and OpenTable.
If you want to be part of something truly special, check us out!
Flexible work at Priceline
Priceline is following a hybrid working model, which includes two days onsite as determined by you and your manager (ideally selecting among Tuesday, Wednesday, or Thursday). On the remaining days, you can choose to be remote or in the office.
Inclusion is a Big Deal !
To be the best travel dealmakers in the world, we believe our team should reflect the broad range of customers and communities we serve. We are committed to cultivating a culture where all employees have the freedom to bring their individual perspectives, life experiences, and passion to work.
Priceline is a proud equal opportunity employer. We embrace and celebrate the unique lenses through which our employees see the world. We’d love for you to join us and help shape what makes our team extraordinary.
Applying for this position
We're excited that you are interested in a career with us. For all current employees, please use the internal portal to find jobs and apply.

Job Title: Senior Consultant, Governance, Risk and Compliance Services (GRCS) Analytics
Job Description:
About the job
Overview
At KPMG, you’ll join a team of diverse and dedicated problem solvers, connected by a common cause turning insight into opportunity for clients and communities around the world.
KPMG Canada’s Risk Consulting practice applies exponential thinking and emerging technologies to solve today’s challenges. Join a diverse team that is always curious and learning, thinking independently and working collaboratively, has a passion to solve difficult problems for our clients, and has fun doing it.
We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Consultant, Governance, Risk and Compliance Services (GRCS) Data Analytics to join our team!
What You Will Do
Focus on supporting our Governance, Risk & Compliance Services practice and work in collaboration with broader KPMG service lines (Risk Services, Deals Advisory, Management Consulting, Audit, Tax and Law) in a cross-functional role to identify, develop and deploy a variety of analytic solutions.
Work closely with clients, regulators, and other stakeholders to understand key business issues.
Utilize advanced analytical techniques and your understanding of AI governance, Data governance and Data management to solve challenging business problems.
Leverage a diverse set of technologies and tools to deliver insights. Work with large volumes of data (structured and unstructured).
Gather and analyze business requirements, perform relevant analyses, and interpret results to develop impactful recommendations and solutions.
Assist with the development of analytical procedures and templates that can be deployed to others to increase the capabilities of the wider team.
Assist with the design and conduct training and information sessions with KPMG practitioners from across the firm.
Assist with drafting professional reports and other client deliverables, such as interactive dashboards, presentation materials and demos, findings and recommendations, summaries of analytical results and insights, etc.
Establish credibility and develop relationships with current and prospective clients.
Provide support/assistance for identification of business opportunities, development of proposals, and prospective client presentations.
Support client workshops to analyze current state operating models, architecture and analytics functions and co-develop and aspirational future state of data and analytics
What You Bring To The Role
2+ years of experience in Data Analytics or Data Governance roles
 Strong business acumen and communication skills to support client communications (both verbal and written)
 Experience manipulating, processing and extracting values from large data sets using data transformation tools, including but not limited to Python, Power Query, Alteryx or Knime.
 Experience with data visualization tools including but not limited to Tableau, Power BI, Databricks or Qlik.
 Experience with data governance and data management tools including but not limited to Azure Purview, Unity Catalog, Informatica, Collibra, Alation or IBM Infosphere.
 Working knowledge in the various data management frameworks & regulations such as DAMA-DMBOK, EDM-DCAM, BCBS-239 or ISO 8000-1.
 Proven experience collaborating within multi-disciplinary teams to address challenges related to unstructured data processing across various industries.
 Ability to utilize data and analytics principles to address business challenges and to explain business value of data and analytics concepts, including data governance and management fundamentals.
 Superior communication skills, both written and verbal, with the ability to articulate technical concepts and their implications to stakeholders at all levels.
 Effectively use generative AI tools, such as ChatGPT, Microsoft Copilot, Google Gemini, Anthropic’s Claude, Perplexity, etc., to streamline tasks, automate repetitive processes, accelerate data analysis, and reveal deeper insights that would otherwise require significant manual effort.
 Certificate, diploma or degree in a relevant field from a recognized Canadian post-secondary institution, or an acceptable combination of education, training and experience within fields related to Data Analytics (including Artificial Intelligence, Data Science, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, etc.)
 Experience or knowledge in one major cloud service MS Azure (preferred), AWS, and GCP, including familiarity with cloud platform data architecture models and relevant tools for scalability, repeatability and performance to support overall solution and full-scope architecture design and build for our clients.
 Experience developing presentations and client-facing reports to support project activities and synthesize findings from work performed into a cohesive final deliverable. Specific experience related to delivering presentations within a Public Sector industry context is preferred
 Basic understanding of Data Warehousing and Data Modeling.
 Basic understanding of AI and ML types of analyses, different models and their purposes/use cases, and available cloud solutions.
Providing you with the support you need to be at your best
Our Values, The KPMG Way
Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters
KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice.
Adjustments and accommodations throughout the recruitment process
At KPMG, we are committed to fostering an inclusive recruitment process where all candidates can be themselves and excel. We aim to provide a positive experience and are prepared to offer adjustments or accommodations to help you perform at your best. Adjustments (informal requests), such as extra preparation time or the option for micro breaks during interviews, and accommodations (formal requests), such as accessible communication supports or technology aids, are tailored to individual needs and role requirements. You will have an opportunity to request an adjustment or accommodation at any point throughout the recruitment process. If you require support, please contact KPMG’s Employee Relations Service team by calling 1-888-466-4778.
AI Usage
We embrace the use of artificial intelligence (AI) to enhance the candidate experience and streamline our recruitment processes. AI tools may help with organizing applications or surfacing relevant qualifications. However, no hiring decisions are made using AI. Every hiring decision is made by our hiring managers and recruitment professionals, who are equipped with training that empowers them to use these tools responsibly. AI technologies used in our recruitment process undergo detailed risk assessments, including security and privacy requirements, that align with KPMG’s Trusted AI framework.
We believe technology should empower human judgment, not replace it. It’s one of the many ways we’re delivering on our vision of being a technology-first, people-driven firm.

About the job
As the Systems Architect, you will play a crucial role in the technical evolution of our business. You must be a visionary builder with a proactive mindset, someone who is not only capable of designing sophisticated frameworks, but who truly enjoys getting hands-on to bring those designs to life. This is a dynamic technical role for a senior developer who can act as a bridge between strategy and the practical realities of our core architecture.
Working in direct partnership with the Technology Team, you will be responsible for the integrity and the actual construction of our technical ecosystem. You will handle everything from prototyping foundational services to implementing complex integrations and refactoring critical infrastructure. This role is a technical cornerstone within a fast-paced environment, requiring an individual who possesses a sharp eye for detail and a passion for technical excellence.
Key responsibilities
Architectural Leadership & Design
Lead the blueprinting and technical design of our enterprise systems, ensuring a robust, secure, and highly scalable architectural framework.
Bridge the gap between high-level business strategy and technical execution, translating complex requirements into elegant, high-performance code.
Maintain technical integrity by establishing best practices for system design, ensuring our infrastructure supports long-term growth and operational excellence.
Modernization & AI Integration
Drive the evolution of our technology stack, identifying and implementing cutting-edge tools and frameworks to maintain our competitive edge.
Pioneer the integration of AI and machine learning capabilities to automate workflows, enhance decision-making, and unlock new efficiencies across the business.
Act as a hands-on builder, prototyping and deploying modern solutions that replace legacy constraints with agile, future-proof technologies.
Process Design & Innovative Development
Reimagine business processes from the ground up, designing and implementing automated systems that streamline operations and eliminate friction.
Lead innovative product development cycles, taking initiative from the initial concept and prototyping through to full-scale deployment and refinement.
Adopt an entrepreneurial approach to problem-solving, anticipating organizational needs before they arise and building solutions that move with purpose and pace.
Business Intelligence & Data Strategy
Architect a sophisticated data ecosystem that serves as a single source of truth for the organization, enabling high-stakes, data-driven decision-making.
Design and implement advanced Power BI dashboards, transforming complex datasets into clear, actionable insights for leadership and stakeholders.
Ensure data excellence by overseeing the integrity of our reporting infrastructure, ensuring all business intelligence is accurate, secure, and delivered with precision.
Are you aligned with our Mission, Vision and Values?
Our Mission is to advance our client-first philosophy by managing investor capital with the highest levels of professionalism and integrity. We are dedicated to capital preservation while simultaneously forging long-term relationships with our real estate developer partners. We are committed to excellence in everything we do and building trust with all our stakeholders.
Our Vision is to be a leading force in the Commercial Real Estate industry, in the markets we serve across North America, known for disrupting the status quo and setting new standards of service and excellence. We aspire to make a significant impact on everyone we engage with—clients, investors, employees, and the communities we support—by consistently delivering unparalleled value and fostering meaningful change.
Our Values:
Authenticity:  We are genuine, transparent, and honest. We build trust through open communication and consistent actions.
Urgency: We move with purpose and pace. We respond quickly and act decisively, knowing that speed matters in our business.
Intellectual Curiosity: We ask questions, challenge assumptions, and never stop learning. We seek out better ways to solve problems.
Loyalty: We are committed to our clients, our colleagues, and our company. We support one another and stick with our commitments.
Entrepreneurial Mindset: We take initiative, embrace accountability, and push beyond the expected. We think and act like owners.
Respectfully Confident: We know our strengths, lead through actions, and stay grounded. We let results speak for themselves.
What we believe our ideal candidate will possess:
Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related technical discipline.
8+ years of experience in systems development and business process design.
Strong background in systems development using C#, JavaScript or Python.
Proven ability to architect complex systems, including data flows, common interfaces, and API integrations.
Expert knowledge of Microservices, Cloud Native environments, and Containerization.
Proficiency in managing and querying both MSSQL and MongoDB.
Solid understanding of scalable networking, load balancers, firewalls, and web standards.
Hands-on experience with Power BI to design dashboards, model data, and translate complex datasets into actionable business insights.
Exceptional problem-solving skills with a track record of using data-driven approaches to solve technical challenges.

About the job
Clio is the global leader in legal AI technology, empowering legal professionals and law firms of every size to work smarter, faster, and more securely.
We are transforming the legal experience for all by bettering the lives of legal professionals while increasing access to justice.
Summary:
We are currently seeking a Software Developer to join our rapidly growing Engineering team. This role is for someone who is passionate about building innovative solutions and being exposed to new challenges and technologies while making an impact. This role is available to candidates based out of our Toronto hub, and you will be expected to be in office minimum twice per week on one of our Anchor Days.
What your team does:
We at Clio have an amazing team that is on a mission to transform the legal experience for all, and our engineering team’s goal is to deliver an incredible experience to our customers. The Vincent Integrations team builds public APIs for Vincent AI as well as connections with external Document Management Systems, allowing customers to integrate Vincent into their existing systems and workflows.
A day in the life might look like:
Work with a team of developers to solve complex problems and provide elegant solutions to Clio customers
Work in an agile environment with our team of full stack developers across a variety of projects
Learning new things, and challenging yourself and honing your craft as a Python expert
Participating in diverse projects and collaborating with multiple engineering teams across Canada, United States, and Europe
Review and provide feedback on code, both from within your own team or across all of Clio
Collaborate with teams across Clio to diagnose, understand, and solve problems, and to build solutions that may span many areas
 What you may have:
Experience in software development, specifically with building web applications at scale using Python
The ability to gain fluency in new technologies quickly and work effectively in an ever-evolving environment that includes distributed teams and customers
Demonstrated success in mentorship in software development, particularly using an Agile process and with large scale SaaS products
A diverse base of knowledge that allows you to help your team solve complex technical problems
A history of past projects (including notable successes and lessons learned) and
Clear communication skills and the ability to build high-trust relationships with fellow Clions and customers
Demonstrate a keen interest in improving your craft by using AI
Don’t have all of those? 
The most important part of this job is that you approach new challenges with curiosity and a drive to apply what you learn to fixing root causes, not just symptoms. Deep curiosity and a desire to learn will help you succeed in this job, combined with a drive to help others by shipping code. We have cross-trained developers coming from Java, Python, C++, Ruby on Rails, and JavaScript backgrounds, and are happy to help you learn Python when you get here.
What you will find here:
Compensation is one of the main components of Clio’s Total Rewards Program. We have developed a series of programs and processes to ensure we are creating fair and competitive pay practices that form the foundation of our human and high-performing culture.
Some highlights of our Total Rewards program include: 
Competitive, equitable salary with top-tier health benefits and dental coverage.
Hybrid work environment, with expectation for local Clions (Vancouver, Calgary, Toronto, Dublin and Sydney) to be in office min. twice per week. 
Flexible time off policy
Pension contribution 
Clioversary recognition program with special acknowledgement at 3, 5, 7, and 10 years
Please note salary bands may differ based on location and local currency. Additionally, benefits may differ depending on the employee's location.
Diversity, Inclusion, Belonging and Equity (DIBE) & Accessibility 
Our team shows up as their authentic selves, and are united by our mission. We are dedicated to diversity, equity and inclusion. We pride ourselves in building and fostering an environment where our teams feel included, valued, and enabled to do the best work of their careers, wherever they choose to log in from. We believe that different perspectives, skills, backgrounds, and experiences result in higher-performing teams and better innovation. We are committed to equal employment and we encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.
Clio provides accessibility accommodations during the recruitment process. Should you require any accommodation, please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Learn more about our culture at clio.com/careers
We're a Human and High Performing AI company, meaning we use artificial intelligence to improve all of our operations. In recruitment, AI helps us streamline the process for greater efficiency. However, we've built our systems to ensure that a human always reviews AI-generated output, and we never make automated hiring decisions.
Disclaimer: We only communicate with candidates through official @clio.com email addresses.

Salary: Salary Range: $25-34/hour (depending on the academic level/experience)
Job Description:
About the job
🌍 About Us
NPX partners with nuclear utilities and new reactor projects to unlock performance through innovation. By combining decades of nuclear operations expertise with AI, digital tools, and lean processes, we help plants operate safely, efficiently, and more cost-effectively. We deliver this expertise through design engineering (mechanical, electrical, and I&C), project management for digital solutions and new nuclear initiatives, human factors engineering, quality assurance, digital strategy, product development, and continuous online monitoring.
We’re committed to supporting the next generation of talent by offering interns the opportunity for meaningful ownership and autonomy over their work. From day 1, students are trusted to take initiative, make decisions, and drive real impact, with the support and resources they need to succeed.
🧠 The Role
We're seeking Innovation Catalyst Interns who are motivated to gain meaningful, hands-on experience beyond the classroom. In this role, you will apply academic knowledge to complex challenges in the nuclear industry and contribute to the development of practical, high-impact solutions. Your primary responsibility is to advance innovation by demonstrating strong analytical abilities, intellectual curiosity, and a commitment to problem solving.
We typically hire co-ops for: Product Development (software, product management, product design), Mechanical and Electrical Engineering, AI Products & Services, Human Factors, People Experience, and Business Operations. Specific responsibilities would differ based on the team, role, and experience level. We urge you to apply if you’re interested in the future of Nuclear!
The role will be defined by the current needs of our teams, with consideration for the students’ interests and strengths to determine the most suitable fit.
Location: Hybrid (Travel requirements are based on project needs; our HQ is in Port Elgin, ON but we primarily work remotely)
Duration: 4-, 8-, and 12-month internships are available depending on the role.
Salary Range: $25-34/hour (depending on the academic level/experience)
🎯 What You’ll Drive 
Assist in day-to-day tasks across various departments. 
Support ongoing projects with research, data analysis, and administrative duties. 
Collaborate with team members on strategic initiatives. 
Participate in brainstorming sessions and contribute ideas to help solve business challenges. 
Help prepare reports, presentations, and other documentation as needed. 
Shadow and support team members to gain insight into different roles within the company. 
Attend meetings and provide input on current projects. 
✨ What You Bring 
Results & Impact: you deliver measurable outcomes and business value.  
Leadership & Influence: you elevate team performance and create influence without being asked.  
Adaptability & Growth: you thrive in dynamic environments and embody a growth mindset.  
Initiative & Innovation: you proactively identify and solve problems.  
Cultural Amplification: you strengthen our culture and role model our values.   
Nuclear capacity is growing worldwide, and NPX is ready to lead as a SaaS-driven innovation partner. This global footprint empowers us to deliver greater impact for clients, strengthen the company, and create lasting career opportunities for our team.

About the job
THE OPPORTUNITY:
We’re seeking an AI-Enthusiast HubSpot Automation Specialist, a hands-on systems thinker who connects the dots between data, automation, and enablement.
You’ll own how HubSpot works across the company: uncovering acquisition opportunities, optimizing lifecycle automation, and experimenting with AI to make every process smarter.
You’ll also be responsible for accelerating Unyte’s overall evolution into an AI-powered organization by identifying, prioritizing and leading high-leverage use cases for AI and automation across the company.
You’ll partner across Marketing, Sales, Customer Experience,Product, Finance and Strategy to:
Transform insights into scalable workflows
Build automations that save hours and drive conversions
Develop AI-powered tools and standards that raise everyone’s game
If you’re the type who sees a messy CRM and gets excited about cleaning it, connecting it, and optimizing it with AI, this is your playground.
WHAT YOU WILL DO:
Lead the planning, prioritization, and implementation of AI tools, automations, and education initiatives across all departments
Educate and empower all Unyte team members with practical AI skills (e.g., prompting, workflow design, AI ethics) by running internal AI bootcamps, curating training resources, and fostering a culture of AI curiosity, responsibility, and experimentation
Serve as the primary owner of HubSpot CRM across Marketing & Sales
Audit and optimize HubSpot pipelines, workflows, scoring, and reporting
Build automations and integrations (HubSpot, Zapier, Make, ChatGPT, etc.)
Analyze lead and customer data to surface insights and opportunities
Create enablement tools and dashboards for Sales and Marketing teams
Use AI features within Hubspot and connected tools to improve efficiency and accuracy (e.g., predictive scoring, data cleaning, content assistance, QA automation)
Define and document best practices for AI and automation across teams
Collaborate with leadership on attribution, growth, and lifecycle strategies
Improve lead handoff, pipeline management, and sales automation 
Identify operational gaps and implement solutions proactively 
YOU ARE A GREAT CANDIDATE IF YOU HAVE:
3-6+ years in Revenue Operations, Marketing Ops, or Sales Enablement
Experience owning Hubspot from end-to-end
Strong data literacy knows how to segment, analyze, and act on CRM data
Familiarity with AI tools (Hubspot AI, Gemini, ChatGPT, Zapier AI, Make, or custom GPTs)
Proficient in building and managing automations and integrations across tools like HubSpot, Stripe, and ZoomInfo
Comfort introducing AI tools into existing workflows
A bias toward execution: you don’t just diagnose problems, you fix them
Curiosity, creativity, and comfort experimenting with new tools and smarter ways of working 
Experience driving org-wide data standards and enablement
Bonus: Certifications in Lean Six Sigma (Green/Black Belt), RPA tools, or AI/Machine Learning
Success in this role looks like: 
Clean, reliable data across the entire funnel 
Reduction in manual operation work for Sales/Marketing and other groups 
Clear, consistent dashboards that leadership trusts 
Faster and clearer lead routing, lifecycle visibility and handoff 
Teams educated on and actively adopting AI-driven tools and workflows 
The business can make better, faster decisions because of the systems and insights that you develop
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU:
Competitive compensation package
Premium benefits package
The opportunity to make important technology and product decisions
Real work/life balance including summer hours
Passionate, collaborative, supportive co-workers and company culture
Flexible fully remote work from anywhere environment with flexible vacation
Optional group meditation sessions
Desire to laugh, have fun, and celebrate others
Youll never get bored in our people-first, fast-paced, constantly evolving and challenging environment.
A fun, caring, safe, inclusive, diverse and mindful workplace is our commitment to our employees.
Don't meet every requirement? Thats ok. At Unyte, we are more interested in who you are as a person, than whether your past experiences align perfectly to the job description. What interests us is your excitement for the role and desire to make a positive impact, while bringing your authentic self to the workplace.
We also believe in living our values so they should align with yours. At Unyte we:
Ask how can I help
Do what matters
Move forward, learn by doing
Are aware, open-minded and responsible
ABOUT UNYTE HEALTH:
Unyte Health is a neurotech company that helps transform the lives of children and adults everyday by empowering mental health and neurodevelopmental professionals, such as psychologists, counselors, social workers and occupational therapists, to guide their clients to feel better, think better, and connect better through improved nervous system regulation.
This is achieved through our suite of powerful SaaS-based digital therapeutic tools, such as the Safe and Sound Protocol (SSP), Integrated Listening System (ILS), and Rest and Restore Protocol (RRP). Healthcare professionals use these noninvasive sound therapies to support clients with conditions such as trauma, anxiety, autism, ADHD, and chronic pain to live more aware, regulated, and resilient lives.

Job Title: Senior / Staff Software Engineer, Web Tools
Job Description:
About the job
Waabi, founded by AI pioneer and visionary Raquel Urtasun, is an AI company building the next generation of self-driving technology. With a world class team and an innovative approach that unleashes the power of AI to “drive” safely in the real world, Waabi is bringing the promise of self-driving closer to commercialization than ever before. Waabi is backed by best-in-class investors across the technology, logistics and the Canadian innovation ecosystem.
With offices in Toronto and San Francisco, Waabi is growing quickly and looking for diverse, innovative and collaborative candidates who want to impact the world in a positive way.
To learn more visit: www.waabi.ai
On Tools, we build software tools that solve Waabi-specific problems and accelerate development. We have a relatively unique set of skills within the software organization that lets us build those tools. The Tools team owns and maintain services that have been built. In this team you will improve on our existing suite of services, and expanding it with new tools.
You will...
 Lead technical and architecture discussions, collaborating with Researchers and Engineers.
 Mentor other software engineers via code reviews, technical design reviews, and sharing general software development best practices.
 Be part of a team of multidisciplinary Engineers and Researchers using an AI-first approach to enable safe self-driving at scale.
 Build and maintain interactive web tools including interactive simulation, custom labelling tools, data annotation tools, dataset curation tools, result comparison tools, and more.
Qualifications:
 Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related engineering disciplines.
 5+ years of industry experience developing production quality software.
 Experience with modern web technologies/libraries for building responsive web applications. Examples: TypeScript, React, or similar languages and tools.
 Experience with a variety of backend technologies and languages. Examples: Go, Python, Rust, C++.
 Experience with cloud infrastructure such as AWS or GCP.- Ability to learn new technologies quickly.
 Empathy for the people who will use the tools you create and maintain.- Open-minded and collaborative team player with willingness to help others.- Passionate about self-driving technologies, solving hard problems, and creating innovative solutions.
Bonus/ nice to have: 
 Experience working with container and cloud infrastructure and managing infrastructure-as-code.
 Experience with 3D visualization (WebGL) / real-time interactive systems.
 Experience with web visualization libraries such as D3.js , three.js , or similar.
 Previous experience or passion in UX/design.
 Experience with software development tools including build system, version control, continuous integration, containers, packaging, profiling, debugging, code review, linting, test automation, and test coverage tools.
 Experience in ML and self-driving.
 Experience working with robotics or machine learning research teams.
 Experience working in an Agile/Scrum environment.
The US yearly salary range for this role is: $141,000 - $249,000 in addition to competitive perks & benefits. Waabi’s yearly salary ranges are determined based on several factors in accordance with the Company’s compensation practices. The salary base range is reflective of the minimum and maximum target for new hire salaries for the position across all US locations. Note: The Company provides additional compensation for employees in this role, including equity incentive awards and an annual performance bonus.
Perks/Benefits:
 Competitive compensation and equity awards.
 Health and Wellness benefits encompassing Medical, Dental and Vision coverage (for full-time employees only).
 Unlimited Vacation.
 Flexible hours and Work from Home support.
 Daily drinks, snacks and catered meals (when in office).
 Regularly scheduled team building activities and social events both on-site, off-site & virtually.
