Job Title: Chief Technology Officer - AI/ML Defense Company in Hyper-Growth
Job Description:
About the job
Chief Technology Officer (CTO)
About The Role
We are seeking an exceptional Chief Technology Officer to lead the technical vision and strategy of a company building mission-critical AI and software systems that shape the future of security, infrastructure, and enterprise decision-making. As CTO, you will be responsible for architecting platforms that combine cutting-edge research, massive-scale data systems, and secure deployment in the most demanding environments.
This role is not about incremental innovation—it is about engineering breakthroughs. You will oversee teams of world-class engineers and researchers, guide product development across AI/ML, cloud-native platforms, and distributed systems, and ensure our technology is resilient, scalable, and trusted by governments, enterprises, and organizations worldwide.
What You’ll Do
Define Technical Vision: Set the company’s technology strategy at the intersection of AI, defense, and enterprise platforms, ensuring both near-term impact and long-term innovation.
Architect Next-Generation Systems: Oversee the design of secure, distributed, high-performance platforms for AI-driven decision-making, simulation, and automation.
Lead World-Class Teams: Recruit, mentor, and inspire top engineers, researchers, and technical leaders across multiple disciplines.
Advance AI & ML Integration: Drive applied AI research into production, including generative AI, computer vision, autonomy, and predictive modeling.
Ensure Security & Trust: Build technology that meets the highest standards of cybersecurity, reliability, and compliance in high-stakes environments.
Partner Across the Organization: Work closely with the CEO, product, and operations leaders to align technology investments with strategic objectives and customer needs.
Represent Technology Externally: Serve as a thought leader in AI and advanced technology, representing the company to partners, governments, enterprises, and the broader tech community.
What We’re Looking For
Proven Leadership: 15+ years of experience in engineering leadership roles, including success scaling technology organizations to global impact.
Technical Depth: Background in distributed systems, AI/ML, or high-performance computing, with hands-on engineering experience earlier in your career.
Strategic Vision: Ability to define long-term technical roadmaps and translate them into actionable, high-impact execution.
Operational Excellence: Experience delivering secure, scalable, and mission-critical products in defense, government, or enterprise domains.
Collaborative Influence: Track record of building partnerships across executive teams, customers, and external stakeholders.
Inspiring Leadership: Ability to attract, grow, and retain top technical talent while fostering a culture of innovation, integrity, and urgency.
Education: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field; PhD a plus.
Why Join
This is a rare opportunity to define the future of technology at an organization building systems that matter—platforms that safeguard national security, transform industries, and unlock the potential of artificial intelligence at scale. As CTO, you will be at the center of the mission: setting the technical direction, solving some of the hardest problems in computing, and building the teams that will deliver breakthrough innovations for years to come.
About Andiamo
Talent Partners for the AI Revolution. As a globally recognized staffing and consulting firm, we specialize in placing the top 2% of technology and go-to-market professionals with the world’s largest and most well-known companies.
For over 20 years, we've maintained the status of tier-one vendor for firms such as Palantir, Amazon, Fluidstack, Bloomberg, Relativity Space, Firefly, MasterCard, Visa, Two Sigma, Citadel, as well as other major financial services firms, elite hedge funds, Google-backed tech start-ups, and major software firms.
Our talent solutions include Permanent Placement, Contract Staffing, Executive Search, and Dedicated Recruiting Services (RPO). Find out more at www.andiamogo.com

About the job
Job ID: 61188
Job Category: Engineering & Technical
Division & Section: Parks, Forestry & Recreation, PFR Policy & Strategic Planning
Work Location: 55 John St, Toronto
Job Type & Duration: 1 Temporary (14 month) vacancy
Salary Range: $113,683.00 - $155,216.00
Ideal Hiring Zone: $126,856.00 - $137,539.00
Shift Information: Monday to Friday, 35 hours per week
Affiliation: Non-Union
Number of Positions Open: 1 
Posting Period: 22-Jan-2026 to 05-Feb-2026 
Job Summary
Are you interested in contributing to the quality of life in Toronto by providing decision makers with sound evidence? We’re looking for lead data engineers who thrive on designing and optimizing scalable pipelines, transforming raw data into actionable insights, and ensuring robust governance across the data lifecycle.
Parks and Recreation (PR) is one of the largest divisions in the City of Toronto. We are the keepers of our common grounds – the parks, recreation facilities and natural spaces where Torontonians come together to build community and play, celebrate and explore. In our role as stewards of these spaces, we contribute to the city’s social and environmental resilience by ensuring that our parks, playing fields, recreation centres, ice rinks and pools, along with trails, meadows and ravines are beautiful, safe and accessible, and that they expand and develop to meet the needs of a growing city and are filled with vibrant, active and engaged communities.
Reporting to the Manager, Research and Analytics within the Policy and Strategic
Planning Branch of PR, you will lead junior staff and foster best practices in data engineering - coding, testing and documentation.
You will work in a matrixed environment with business domain experts including data enablement and governance, data analytics and BI, program evaluation, social programs, operations, capital construction, planning, technology transformation, and public engagement.
Major Responsibilities
Data Engineering Leadership
AWS expertise: Implements detailed plans and utilize a wide range of AWS services to build and maintain scalable, secure and efficient data infrastructure. Key services include S3, Redshift, Kinesis, EMR, Glue, Data Zone, Lake Formation and CloudFormation.
Data Pipeline Development: Performs data pipeline development related activities including design, implementation and maintenance of robust ETL/ELT processes using tools such as AWS Glue, DBT (Data Build Tool) and Apache Spark.
Data Processing: Utilize Python and Apache Spark for large-scale data processing, transformation and analysis.
Data Modeling: Design and implement efficient data models to support analytics, machine learning and reporting needs.
Streaming Solutions: Develop and maintain both batch and real-time data streaming solutions using technologies such as AWS Kinesis.
Data Governance: Implement and adhere to data governance policies to ensure data quality, privacy and compliance with regulations.
Collaboration: Work closely with data scientists, analysts and other stakeholders to understand data requirements and provide tailored solutions.
Documentation and Knowledge Sharing: Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data processes, pipelines, and models. Share knowledge with team members and contribute to the team's overall growth.
People Leadership and Relationship Management
Supervises, motivates and trains assigned staff regarding data engineering ensuring effective teamwork, high standards of work quality and organizational performance, continuous learning, and encourages innovation in others.
Supervises the day to day operation of all assigned staff including the scheduling, assigning and reviewing of work. Authorizes and coordinates vacation and overtime requests. Monitors and evaluates staff performance, approves salary increments, hears grievances, and recommends disciplinary action when necessary.
Fosters successful relationships and synergies with divisional staff and staff of divisional partners and agencies through consultation and mediation, participation, presentations, and verbal and written communication.
Manages all aspects of contracts with consultants and contractors engaged in work on data engineering including preparation of contract documents, tenders, recommendation of contract award, and monitoring contractors' progress to ensure that all work is completed efficiently and effectively.
Works with various internal and external partners, private sector collectors, disseminators and analysts to collect and analyze data on behalf of the division.
Works with partners on developing and implementing a data engineering and pipeline development work.
Works with private sector partners to make City data engineering methods and results available for use by third parties.
Planning, Strategy and Communication
Participates in the process of planning and developing long range objectives of the division and in organization and management change initiatives relating to data engineering
Develops prototypes, proof of concepts for data pipelines supporting algorithms, predictive models and custom analysis that leverage the value of available data sets.
Plans and develops methods and procedures for building, optimizing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines, data processing workflows, and governance frameworks to ensure data quality, security, and compliance.
Researches best practices and prepares briefing notes and technical documentation to support data architecture decisions, pipeline development standards, governance frameworks and implementation of scalable solutions.
Provides input into and administers assigned budget ensuring that expenditures are controlled and maintained within approved budget limitations.
Prepares correspondence, presentations and reports to City Council, Standing Committees, Councillors and public inquiries related to divisional matters.
Develops, maintains and implements data management, deployment and use strategy for the division with a focus on employing existing data assets in new ways and leveraging novel dynamic data sources for evidence-based decision- making.
Ensures that data engineering solutions, technical deliverables and documentation are of high technical quality and recommendations are consistent with the Division's and City's strategic plans and results are produced in a timely and efficient manner.
Applies multi-disciplinary concepts to develop and implement innovative solutions to complex problems.
Produces evidence-based analytical solutions to issues related to planning, programming and operations with actionable information derived from use of data assets.
Key Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Information Technology, or a related field or an approved equivalent combination of education and related experience. A masters degree would be preferred.
Extensive experience leading data engineering projects supporting data analytics, BI reporting, data science, applied research, geospatial analysis, machine learning. Experience with data mesh architecture concepts and implementation would be considered an asset.
Extensive experience in AWS technologies, particularly in data-related services (S3, Redshift, Kinesis, EMR, Glue, etc.) with strong proficiency in Python programming, especially for data processing tasks. AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Certified Data Analytics - Specialty, AWS Certified Big Data -Specialty) would be considered an asset.
Considerable experience leading a data engineering team supporting data analysts, BI specialists, data scientists and other data professionals using matrix management approaches and using robust code repository management, streamlined request workflows and effective ticketing systems.
Experience with big data processing frameworks, particularly Apache Spark, and hands-on experience with ETL/ELT processes and tools like AWS Glue and DBT.
Knowledge of other cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, GCP) for multi-cloud strategies.
Understanding of machine learning workflows and MLOps practices
Excellent oral communication, writing, presentation and interpersonal skills, to deal effectively with technical staff, business unit staff, and senior management; and communicate information in a manner that is understandable to a wide range of individuals.
Highly developed people leadership skills and ability to coach and support staff development.
Highly developed facilitation, problem-solving, and conflict resolution skills.
Strategic thinking skills, with the ability to develop recommendations that advance the organization and improve service to the public.
Ability to exercise discretion and judgement with confidential information pertaining to human resources matters and the transformation initiative.
Exceptional ability to seamlessly distill very technical concepts to business users and vice versa.
Exceptionally self-motivated and directed approach, with a keen attention to detail and organization.
Political acuity with knowledge/leadership in government innovation.
Join Us!
If you are interested in learning more about the Senior Data Solutions Integrator (Data Engineering) role, you can participate in a virtual Microsoft Teams information session with Jia Lu, Manager Research & Analytics on Tuesday, January 27 or Monday, February 2 from 12:30 pm – 1:00 pm. You will have the opportunity to ask questions related to the position, working for the City of Toronto's Parks & Recreation division, as well as the City's application process.
Please register to participate in the information session using one of the following links:
Tuesday, January 27 - https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/9057b078-f2af-4fd1-99a1-6ac282605756@f0bc8ec6-9ed8-4d0c-9189-411ad949cc65
Monday, February 2 - https://events.teams.microsoft.com/event/9703586a-1b52-4a95-8402-94c6f9e21005@f0bc8ec6-9ed8-4d0c-9189-411ad949cc65
It is important to note that this is a public information session. To remain anonymous, participants must join through web browser and ensure their login name reflects that preference.
Note To Current City of Toronto Employees
City of Toronto employees are eligible to apply for the posted job opportunity, but cannot hold two different jobs. To be considered for this job posting, you must indicate that you are a "Current City of Toronto employee" on the on-line application form, and provide your "Employee Number".
Equity, Diversity and Inclusion
The City is an equal opportunity employer, dedicated to creating a workplace culture of inclusiveness that reflects the diverse residents that we serve. Learn more about the City’s commitment to employment equity.
Accommodation
The City of Toronto is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive organization. We are committed to providing barrier-free and accessible employment practices in compliance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). Should you require Code-protected accommodation through any stage of the recruitment process, please make them known when contacted and we will work with you to meet your needs. Disability-related accommodation during the application process is available upon request. Learn more about the City’s Hiring Policies and Accommodation Process.

Job Description
Performs a broad range of activities as assigned to support Engineers and generally involve developing components of solutions with a focus on analytics, support, testing, and proof of concepts aligned to business and technology objectives.
Key Accountabilities
CUSTOMER
Develop new solutions as required for engineering programs and projects within assigned area and may also develop prototypes and proof of concepts aligned to business needs
Participate in the conceptual and logical engineering designs around the advancement of the overall assigned portfolio
Analyze the technical requirements to recommend pragmatic and sound engineering specific solutions for own area
Work with other stakeholders, internal technology partners to ensure engineering solutions meet technical direction, requirements, performance, time-to-market and innovation goals
Contribute enterprise and/or line of business engineering strategies and mandates
Respond to routine or standard requests from internal and/or external customers
SHAREHOLDER
Understand relationships between work processes and the business and ensure awareness of costs related to own work
Monitor product lifecycles, ensuring specifications and functionality support business objectives and engineering decisions, undertaking re-development where required
Document and verify system components, applications, system infrastructure, security, integration, operability and engineering related architecture designs associated with a program or project
Participate in quality management reviews, in particular reviews of the designs, prototypes and other requirements work products to ensure they fulfill the requirements
Develop as-built program activities to establish the level of detail needed using configuration management processes
Provide support to modifications to ensure the accuracy of drawings and other technical baseline documents
EMPLOYEE / TEAM
Continuously enhance knowledge / expertise in own area and keep current with leading-edge technologies and trends
Prioritize and manage own workload in order to deliver quality results and meet timelines
Support a positive work environment that promotes service to the business, quality, innovation and teamwork and ensure timely communication of issues/ points of interest
Participate in knowledge transfer within the team and business units
Establish effective relationships across multiple business and technology partners, program and project managers
Identify and recommend opportunities to enhance productivity, effectiveness and operational efficiency of the business unit and/or team
BREADTH & DEPTH
Basic working knowledge of specific domain or engineering frameworks, technology, tools, processes and procedures
Foundational knowledge of TD applications, systems, networks, innovation, design activities, best practices, business / organization, Bank standards
Works within fairly well defined parameters as assigned
Uses existing procedures to solve routine problems; makes limited exceptions
Generally reports to a Manager or above
Experience & Education
University or post-graduate degree
Strong academic background (e.g., computer science, engineering)
2-3 years relevant experience
knowledge of Azure Cloud, Python, API development preferred
Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.
Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Job Description
The AVP Process Improvement is a senior executive responsible for defining, leading, and scaling a bank-wide process improvement and customer transformation agenda. This role will architect the methodologies, tools, and operating model that enhance efficiency, strengthen risk management, improve the customer journey and unlock enterprise-level productivity—leveraging advanced automation, AI-enabled solutions, and industry-leading process-design practices.
This role will partner closely with Fraud, KYC, Insider Threat and Investigations, Technology, Data, and Risk executives to build a culture of operational excellence. The role will drive the strategic business strategy roadmap and execution of process engineering, emerging technology adoption, and continuous improvement across high-risk, high-velocity environments.
Depth & Scope
Provides people management leadership by hiring the best talent, setting goals, developing staff, managing employee performance and compensation decisions, promoting teamwork and handling any/all disciplinary actions, as required
Sets the enterprise vision for process engineering, automation, and operational excellence; develops the multi-year roadmap aligned to business strategy, regulatory expectations, and efficiency commitments
Establishes operating model that scales best-in-class process methodologies (Lean, Six Sigma, BPM, workflow design, AI-enabled decisioning) across the organization
Leads transformation of end-to-end processes across Fraud Operations, KYC/CDD, Insider Threat, Investigations, Fraud Claims, Billing Disputes, and related Financial Crimes functions
Re-designs workflows to improve quality, throughput, cycle time, customer impact, and control strength
Builds and maintains enterprise standards for process mapping, process health monitoring, and performance measurement frameworks
Develops and executes the automation agenda (RPA, workflow orchestration, business rules, machine learning, GenAI-powered productivity tools)
Drives responsible AI adoption in operational processes, including alert triage, decision automation, investigation support, and workflow optimization
Partners with Technology, Data, and Model Risk to ensure scalable, secure, compliant deployment of automation and AI solutions
Applies deep domain expertise across Fraud, KYC/CDD, and Insider Threat to identify opportunities to modernize control processes, reduce risk exposure, and lower unit cost
Establishes metrics, KRIs/KPIs, and governance to ensure process integrity and regulatory compliance
Builds customer complaints and analytics process to drive capability and operational improvements
Champions a culture of continuous improvement across the organization
Designs and delivers enterprise training programs on process excellence and automation
Builds a high-performing team of process engineers, automation specialists, and operational-excellence leaders
Education & Experience
10+ years of progressive leadership in process engineering, operational excellence, or transformation roles (preferably within Financial Services)
Deep experience in Fraud Operations, KYC/CDD, Insider Threat/Investigations, AML/BSA or other Financial Crimes domains
Demonstrated success leading end-to-end process redesign across complex, highly regulated environments
Strong expertise in automation technologies (RPA, workflow engines, decisioning platforms) and AI-enabled productivity
Proven ability to build and lead large transformation programs with measurable cost, productivity, and risk-reduction outcomes

Job Title: Software Development Engineer II, Sourcing Performance
Job Description:
About the job
Description
Want to develop software systems for a team that’s at the center of the supply chain universe? Sourcing Performance, part of Supply Chain Optimization Technologies (SCOT), is seeking a software development engineer to design, build, and maintain our critical purchase order and supply chain performance systems.
At Amazon, we work hard to make the products our customers want and love available for purchase on our website. Last year, we ordered more than 10 billion items from thousands of vendors. Each time we procure inventory, there are critical financial and operational decisions that must be made, and performance standards that our vendors and internal teams must meet to ensure an optimal retail experience for our customers. Sourcing Performance team owns the software systems that make key decisions about Purchase Orders (POs), create and transmit POs to vendors, measure vendor performance against standards and policies, and use feedback, coaching, and financial chargebacks to drive vendors to reduce defects in the supply chain.
In your role as a Software Development Engineer II (SDE 2) on the Sourcing Performance team, you will design system architecture and develop software in an AWS cloud environment, enhance our web portals which are used by thousands of product vendors and internal employees, create unit and integration tests, implement alarms to alert when our services are not operating optimally in the production environment, monitor system performance, deep-dive into the root cause of important issues and defects, and acquire the domain knowledge necessary to understand how Amazon’s supply chain operates to serve our customers.
Together, you and your engineering teammates, technical and product managers will work to invent the next generation of Sourcing Performance services at Amazon, improve the way that we source and procure inventory, and reduce sourcing defects for Earth's most customer-centric company.
A day in the life
A day in the life
Amazon offers a full range of benefits that support you and eligible family members, including domestic partners and their children. Benefits can vary by location, the number of regularly scheduled hours you work, length of employment, and job status such as seasonal or temporary employment. The benefits that generally apply to regular, full-time employees include:
 Medical, Dental, and Vision Coverage
 Maternity and Parental Leave Options
 Paid Time Off (PTO)
 RRSP

 3+ years of non-internship professional software development experience
 2+ years of non-internship design or architecture (design patterns, reliability and scaling) of new and existing systems experience
 Experience programming with at least one software programming language
 Experience effectively communicating complex concepts through written and verbal communication
 3+ years of full software development life cycle, including coding standards, code reviews, source control management, build processes, testing, and operations experience
 Experience leveraging Generative AI to accelerate or improve the software development process
Preferred Qualifications
 Bachelor's degree in computer science or equivalent
 Experience implementing highly available, highly scalable services in a containerized, cloud-hosted environment
 Experience incorporating a breadth of data layer technologies (relational, NoSQL, distributed search) into software systems, and performing data deep-dives, writing and debugging complex data queries
 Experience building AI agents to handle customer inquiries, or to administer a business process flow
 An ideal candidate will have a strong intrinsic business sense and experience working on software products that serve the business domain, with basic knowledge of procurement and accounting practices

Job Description
Job Description:
We are looking for a detailed-oriented Cloud Security and AI Test Engineers to join our team. This individual will focus on automating and validating Compliance-as-Code (CaC) policies across multi cloud environments including GCP, Azure and AWS. In this role you will blend your expertise in cloud security with advanced AI tools to enhance compliance, security and test automation, ensuring continuous validation within multi cloud environments.
Key Responsibilities
Automated testing for cloud policies
Design, develop, implement and maintain AI-driven automated test frameworks for the behavior of existing compliance as a code policy across cloud environments (GCP/AWS/Azure) in alignment with banking regulations.
Implement AI- driven test environments using Azure Foundry and Azure ML to create realistic, mock cloud setups, including network and IAM configurations to simulate and test policies effectively
Utilize Azure AI Search, Azure OpenAI, and Azure Machine learning to build intelligent validation routines that can predict policy compliance issues and recommend remediation steps
Develop comprehensive positive negative and edge exception test cases to validate policy enforcement logic. 
Maintain a test suite library and ensure traceability between compliance requirements validation cases and artifacts
Collaborate with CaC policy developers and security architects and Cloud Service Owners to understand intended behavior and failure conditions
Continuous Testing & CI/CD Integration
Integrate AI- assisted compliance validation into CI/CD pipelines GitHub actions GitHub workflows using GitHub Copilot for scripting efficiencies and M365 Copilot studio for creating streamlined policy validation templates
Automate security scanning and validation of terraform deployments with Python 
Validate the enforcement of banking cloud security policies by embedding automated compliance checks into DevSecOps workflows and actions. 
Cloud Security and Regulatory Compliance enforcement
Work closely with security, DevSecOps teams, and Cloud Compliance governance teams to define and enforce cloud security controls in accordance with regulatory mandates. 
Validate cloud resource configurations against financial industry standards, (NIST, ISO 27001, SOC 2) 
Reporting & Audit Readiness 
Implement/test logging and monitoring solutions to detect compliance violations in real time. 
Automate/validate the generation of compliance reports and dashboards using tools like SonarQube, Wiz.IO, Splunk, Dynatrace, AppOmni
Ensure that all TD Standards & STIG requirements for IAAS, PaaS, SaaS CaC development, and testing activities are traceable and auditable for internal risk assessments and external regulatory audits. 
Required Skills And Experience
 Strong Knowledge of GCP, Azure, AWS.
 4+ years in Cloud Security, DevSecOps, AI or Cloud Engineering roles.
Cloud infrastructure as a code - Experience with Terraform, Helm, ARM, JSON, YAML, REGO
Compliance as Code (CaC)- Hands on experience with HashiCorp Sentinel, Azure policy, Wiz policy, GCP Org policy and Open Policy Agent, Kubernetes
CI/CD Pipelines- Experience with GitHub actions, Jenkins, Terraform, HashiCorp Vault, Nexus
AI Tools - Experience Azure Open AI, Azure Content Safety, Azure Foundry, Azure AI Builder, GitHub Copilot, M365 Copilot Studio, and AML
Scripting and Automation- Proficiency in Python, Bash, PowerShell, and automate testing framework.
Cloud Security & Compliance – Understanding of CIS benchmarks, NIST standards and security frameworks.
Preferred Qualifications
Specifications; Azure fundamentals certification Azure security engineer associate, GCP fundamentals certification
Experience with multi cloud security testing GCP, Azure and AWS
Experience with Container security and Kubernetes policy enforcement
Education
Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Data Science (BS/MS)
Information security certification / accreditation an asset
Cloud & AI certifications
4+ years of relevant experience
Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.
Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Job Description
Role Summary
The Information Security Specialist – AI Penetration Tester is responsible for conducting advanced offensive security testing across AI/ML systems, LLM integrations, GenAI platforms, and associated infrastructure. This role serves as a subject-matter expert in AI/LLM security, partnering with engineering, cyber, cloud, and architecture teams to identify vulnerabilities, improve controls, and ensure safe and compliant deployment of AI capabilities across the enterprise.
Responsibilities
AI/LLM Offensive Security & Vulnerability Testing
Conduct Penetration Tests: Design and execute comprehensive penetration tests targeting AI/ML models, LLM applications, model pipelines, retrieval systems, data agents, and AI-enabled business workflows.
AI/LLM Vulnerability Analysis: Identify vulnerabilities such as jailbreaking, prompt injection, model extraction, adversarial ML attacks, data poisoning, RAG bypasses, and safety guardrail circumvention.
Tooling & Automation: Evaluate and develop tooling (including internal utilities and open‑source frameworks) to automate and scale AI/LLM security testing.
Security Architecture, Hardening & Risk Assessment
Assess Security Posture: Analyze training data governance, guardrail design, inference endpoints, system prompts, agent autonomy, model monitoring, and model‑ops pipelines.
Risk Assessments: Perform security and safety risk analyses on new and existing AI/ML deployments, including cloud‑based services, APIs, model marketplaces, and third‑party LLM integrations.
Model Supply Chain Security: Assess AI supply chain risks, dependency integrity, and alignment with enterprise standards and regulatory obligations.
Documentation, Reporting & Communication
Report Findings: Deliver clear, actionable findings to both technical and non‑technical stakeholders. Produce detailed reporting including:
Executive summaries
Technical proof‑of‑concepts
Prioritized remediation recommendations
Stakeholder Engagement: Collaborate with Engineering, Data Science, Cloud, Cyber Defense, Architecture, and Risk to remediate findings and improve AI security posture.
Governance, Standards & Continuous Improvement
Develop Best Practices: Contribute to organization-wide AI security standards, policies, control objectives, and hardening practices.
Regulatory Compliance: Ensure AI penetration testing aligns with regulatory, privacy, model safety, and internal policy requirements.
Continuous Learning: Maintain deep expertise in emerging AI threats, industry frameworks, evaluation methodologies, and global safety standards.
Incident Response & Audit Support
Participate in AI/ML–related security incident investigations, providing subject-matter expertise on root cause analysis and exploitation methods.
Support audit preparation and assist in drafting management responses, remediation plans, and risk treatment documentation.
Requirements
Technical Skills
5+ years in application security or penetration testing, with hands-on experience in AI/ML environments preferred.
7+ years of experience using penetration testing tools (Metasploit, Burp Suite, Nmap, Kali, etc.).
Strong knowledge of AI/LLM vulnerabilities including OWASP Top 10 for LLMs, adversarial attacks, prompt injection, and model safety testing frameworks.
Familiarity with scripting and automation (Python preferred), model interrogation techniques, and cloud-native AI services (Azure, AWS, GCP).
Core Competencies
Strong analytical and problem‑solving abilities with high attention to detail.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills for diverse stakeholder groups.
Demonstrated understanding of ethical hacking principles and responsible AI use.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience penetration testing AI/LLM platforms, cloud workloads, and PCI-scoped environments.
Knowledge of security frameworks (NIST AI RMF, OWASP LLM/ML, ISO 42001, MITRE ATLAS).
Relevant certifications: OSCP, CEH, GPEN, CISSP, or AI/ML security certifications.
Experience supporting audits, compliance reviews, and incident response activities.
Who We Are
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.
Our Total Rewards Package

About the job
Take your career to new heights with Loopio! 🚀✨
We are seeking a Lead Product Manager to drive the vision, strategy, and execution of our innovative AI-first experiences that enable users to seamlessly create, edit, and refine proposals, streamlining the sales process and unlocking new levels of efficiency and personalization. The ideal candidate brings a proven track record of delivering innovative AI experiences to enterprise customers, a solid understanding of AI/LLM architectures, and the ability to translate complex systems into intuitive customer workflows.
You will initially work as part of the team that owns the "front door" of our user experience: the intelligent ingestion and understanding of RFPs, security questionnaires, due diligence documents, etc. You will work directly with our Engineering and AI/ML teams to optimize how we ingest and interpret complex data from documents like Word, PDF, Excel, and online procurement and diligence portals.
This role is designed to expand. As you leverage AI to solve the immediate challenge of high-fidelity data ingestion, you will lay the groundwork for our broader ambition: AI-first agentic experiences. We need a leader who can deliver immediate value through AI-powered document processing today, while architecting the autonomous agent workflows of tomorrow.
💻 What You’ll Be Doing
Monitor industry trends and deeply understand the needs of enterprise sales teams and proposal managers, and conduct discovery with users to validate problems, pain points, and success criteria.
Lead end-to-end product lifecycle: discovery, requirements, prioritization, and delivery.
Collaborate with engineering, design, data science, and GTM teams to deliver features that balance feasibility, scalability, and usability.
Drive iterative product development, leveraging rapid prototyping and experimentation.
Partner closely with Engineering and AI/ML teams to understand dependencies and ensure technical feasibility and data readiness for building reliable AI experiences.
Evaluate trade-offs in AI system design (latency, context windows, parsing accuracy, model selection, fine-tuning, prompt engineering) to optimize for customer value.
Define and own the outcomes you define for your roadmap, delivering meaningful and measurable success for our customers.
✨ What You’ll Bring To The Team
7+ years in B2B SaaS product management, including at least 2 years in a lead or senior PM role on empowered product teams.
A data-centric mindset, relentlessly pursuing evidence and systematically leveraging it in your decision-making and communication processes
A proven track record of launching successful B2B AI-enabled products is a must-have, ideally within the domain of Document/Knowledge Management and Search.
Familiarity with LLMs, RAG, document parsing, embeddings, vector databases, and agent orchestration frameworks.
Ability to engage with engineers and data scientists on system architecture, dependencies, and trade-offs.
Entrepreneurial, user-centric, and results-oriented.
Excited by ambiguity, innovation, and pushing the boundaries of what AI can do for enterprise workflows.
Strong strategic thinking and analytical skills, with the ability to translate market insights into actionable product strategies.
Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to influence and collaborate with stakeholders and customers at all levels.
Where You’ll Work 📍
Loopio is a global company, HQ’d in Canada, that embraces flexible and effective work models. While many of our teams operate remotely, this role is part of a new, strategic product team that will work in a hybrid model to accelerate innovation and foster deep collaboration.
For this role, you will be based in our Toronto, Ontario hub, with the expectation of working from our co-working space in downtown Toronto 3 days per week. This approach is intentionally designed to give you the best of both worlds: high-impact, in-person collaboration with your team to drive impactful product initiatives, and the flexibility of focused work-from-home days.
Our co-working space located in the heart of Downtown Toronto and a 12-minute walk from Union Station
Our employees (or Loopers, as we call ourselves!) live and work in 🇨🇦 Canada (British Columbia and Ontario), 🇬🇧 London, and 🇮🇳 India (specifically in Gujarat, Maharashtra, and Bengaluru).
You’ll collaborate with your teams virtually across the UK, India, and North America (we’re just a Zoom call and Slack message away!) with core sync hours and focus time for headsdown work 🙇🏾 during the workday
We encourage asynchronous collaboration to effectively work as a global #OneTeam!
Why You’ll ♥️ Working at Loopio
Your manager supports your development by providing ongoing feedback and regular 1-on-1s, we leverage Lattice for our 1:1s and performance conversations 
You will have the opportunity to elevate 🪄 your craft and the opportunity to explore your creativity, with a dedicated professional mastery allowance for more learning support! We encourage experimentation and innovative thinking to drive business impact.
We offer a wide range of health and wellness benefits to support your physical and mental well-being, starting day 1️⃣ with Loopio.
We’ll set you up to work remotely with a MacBook laptop 🍏, a monthly phone and internet subsidy, and a work-from-home budget to help get your home office all set up. 
You’ll be joining a supportive culture that has thoughtfully built out opportunities for connections in a remote first environment.
Participate in 🎤 townhalls, AMA (Ask-Me-Anything), and quarterly celebrations to celebrate the big wins and milestones as #oneteam!
Our four active Employee Resource Groups offer opportunities for employees to learn and connect year-round. 
You’ll be a part of an award-winning workplace 🏆with an opportunity to make a big impact on the business.
Questioning your qualifications? Read this ‼️ Hi there, we recognize that all too often, potential candidates don’t apply for a position simply because they don’t hit every single criteria included in the job description—particularly members of underrepresented groups.
Whether or not your experience ✅ checks off all the boxes on a job posting, we still encourage you to apply to ensure that your application receives a review from our team. We understand that a resume can only showcase so much during the applicant stage, so we've created prompts in the application for you to share more about yourself. If you've made a career transition (or a few!), you’re self taught in a new role, or you have skills/experience you’d like to highlight, we want to hear more about what you could bring to the table.
AI in Recruitment 👩🏻‍💻  At Loopio, we leverage artificial intelligence (AI) technology to enhance our recruitment process. These tools assist with tasks such as resume screening, drafting preliminary job descriptions, generating initial interview questions, transcription and occasionally sourcing prospective candidates. However, AI is never used to make final hiring decisions; our use of AI serves to support repetitive and administrative tasks in order to streamline our hiring and recruitment workflows. We are committed to the responsible use of AI in our hiring practices, prioritizing both an improved candidate experience and operational efficiency. Our standardized hiring practices remain focused on reducing biases, with all key hiring decisions solely made by our team. We continuously review and refine our hiring practices to align with industry best practices and evolving legal guidelines
Loopio is an equal opportunity employer that is deeply committed to building equitable workplaces that are diverse and inclusive. We actively encourage candidates from all backgrounds and lifestyles to consider us as a future employer. Please contact a member of our Talent Experience team (work@loopio.com) should you require accommodations at any point during our virtual interview processes.

About the job
Spaulding Ridge is an advisory and IT implementation firm. We help global organizations get financial clarity into the complex, daily sales, and operational decisions that impact profitable revenue generations, efficient operational performance, and reliable financial management.
At Spaulding Ridge, we believe all business is personal. Core to our values is our relationships with our clients, our business partners, our team, and the global community. Our employees dedicate their time to helping our clients transform their business, from strategy through implementation and business transformation.
The Client Director is a strategic leadership role responsible for driving client success, leading complex engagements, and growing Spaulding Ridge’s Data Solutions business. This individual will serve as a trusted advisor to clients, lead cross-functional teams, and ensure the successful delivery of transformative data programs. The role also includes accountability for project profitability, team development, and business development efforts.
Key Responsibilities:
Lead client engagements from discovery through delivery, serving as the primary point of contact and strategic advisor across multiple workstreams 
Coordinate and direct project teams through the delivery of data analytics platforms, customer 360 implementations, data warehousing enhancements, reporting modernization efforts, and enterprise-scale data integration initiatives
Spearhead client projects focused on developing data-driven business insights, predictive modeling solutions, and AI-driven analytics to enhance client business outcomes
Oversee project delivery to ensure high-quality execution, client satisfaction, and achievement of business outcomes while managing scope, timeline, and budget 
Manage project financials, including forecasting, margin performance, and resource planning to ensure profitability and long-term client value 
Support business development activities, including proposal development, client presentations, and collaboration with channel partners and internal sales teams
Identify and expand client relationships, uncovering new opportunities for cross-sell and upsell across Spaulding Ridge’s portfolio 
Coach and mentor consulting teams, fostering a culture of excellence, innovation, and continuous learning 
Contribute to practice development through thought leadership, internal training, and development of intellectual property and delivery standards 
Collaborate with practice leadership to build a high-performing team and scale the Data Solutions business 
Support client demos and proof-of-concept initiatives, helping clients evaluate and adopt modern data technologies 
Drive best practices in project delivery, client engagement, and solution design to ensure consistent, high-impact outcomes 
Approach problems creatively, applying technology and strategic thinking to solve complex business challenges 
Qualifications:
Minimum of 8 years of experience in consulting, professional services, or a related field, with a focus on data, analytics, or digital transformation 
Proven experience leading complex client programs with accountability for delivery, margin, and client satisfaction 
Strong business development skills, with a track record of originating and closing new business through direct and partner channels 
Demonstrated ability to lead cross-functional teams, including consultants, architects, and sales professionals 
Experience managing project financials, including forecasting, utilization, and margin optimization 
Excellent communication and presentation skills, with the ability to influence executive stakeholders and translate technical concepts into business value 
Experience in change management and business process improvement is a plus 
Bachelor’s degree in a relevant field (e.g., Business, Information Systems, Data Science) 
Willingness to travel up to 50% as needed to support client engagements and team collaboration 
Spaulding Ridge’s Commitment to an Inclusive Workplace 
When we engage the expertise, insights, and creativity of people from all walks of life, we become a better organization, we deliver superior services to clients, and we transform our communities and world for the better.
At Spaulding Ridge, we believe our team should reflect the rich diversity of society and we take seriously the responsibility to cultivate a workplace where every bandmate feels accepted, respected, and valued for who they are. We do this by creating a culture of trust and belonging, through practices and policies that support inclusion, and through our employee led Employee Resource Groups (ERGs): CRE (Cultural Race and Ethnicity), Women Elevate, PROUD and Mental Wellness Alliance.

If you are interested in applying for employment with Spaulding Ridge and are in need of accommodation or special assistance to navigate our website or to complete your application, please send an e-mail with your request to our VP of Human Resources, Cara Halladay (challaday@spauldingridge.com). Requests for reasonable accommodation will be considered on a case-by-case basis.
Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to their age, race, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, protected veteran status or disability.

About the job
ZS is a place where passion changes lives. As a management consulting and technology firm focused on improving life and how we live it, we transform ideas into impact by bringing together data, science, technology and human ingenuity to deliver better outcomes for all. Here you’ll work side-by-side with a powerful collective of thinkers and experts shaping life-changing solutions for patients, caregivers and consumers, worldwide. ZSers drive impact by bringing a client-first mentality to each and every engagement. We partner collaboratively with our clients to develop custom solutions and technology products that create value and deliver company results across critical areas of their business. Bring your curiosity for learning, bold ideas, courage and passion to drive life-changing impact to ZS.
Strategy Insights and Planning Associate 
ZS's Strategy Insights and Planning teams partner with clients to design and deliver solutions to help them tackle a broad range of business challenges. Our teams work on multiple projects simultaneously, leveraging advanced data analytics and problem-solving techniques. Our recommendations and solutions are based on rigorous research and analysis underpinned by deep expertise and thought leadership.
What You’ll Do
Leverage problem solving skills and frameworks to develop solutions to client business problems 
Conduct market research and/or desk research to derive insights and inform client decision making 
Design custom analyses using tools like Excel, Access, Confirmit and ZS's proprietary software 
Synthesize and communicate results to clients and ZS teams 
Collaborate with client and ZS teams to implement solutions 
Take responsibility and ownership for assigned project deliverables 
What You’ll Bring
Bachelor's or master's degree required in any discipline with strong record of academic success in quantitative and analytic coursework such as operations research, applied mathematics, management science, data science, statistics, econometrics or engineering. 
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite 
High motivation, good work ethic, maturity and personal initiative 
Effective oral and written communication skills 
Empathy, adaptability and emotional intelligence 
Strong attention to detail, with a quality-focused mindset 
Self-discipline for planning and organizing tasks 
Aptitude for, and enjoyment of, working in teams 
Fluency In English
Client - first mentality
Intense work ethic
Collaborative spirit and problem-solving approach
How you’ll grow:
Cross-functional skills development & custom learning pathways
Milestone training programs aligned to career progression opportunities
Internal mobility paths that empower growth via s-curves, individual contribution and role expansions
Hybrid working model:
We are committed to giving our employees a flexible and connected way of working. ZS offers a comprehensive total rewards package including health and well-being, financial planning, annual leave, personal growth and professional development. Our robust skills development programs, multiple career progression options and internal mobility paths, and collaborative culture empower you to thrive as an individual and global team member.

A flexible and connected ZS allows us to combine work from home and onsite presence at clients/ZS offices for the majority of our week. The magic of ZS culture and innovation thrives in both planned and spontaneous face-to-face connections.
Travel:

Job Title: Senior Manager, Analytics & Experimentation // Gestionnaire senior, Analyse et expérimentation
Job Description:
About the job
Mistplay est l'application de fidélité n°1 pour les joueurs mobiles. Notre communauté de millions de joueurs mobiles engagés utilise Mistplay pour découvrir de nouveaux jeux et gagner des récompenses. Les joueurs sont récompensés pour le temps et l'argent qu'ils consacrent aux jeux et peuvent échanger ces récompenses contre des cartes cadeaux. Mistplay a pour mission d'être le meilleur moyen de jouer à des jeux mobiles pour tous, partout dans le monde ! Téléchargez Mistplay sur le Google Play Store ici et suivez-nous sur Instagram, Twitter et Facebook.
📍 Veuillez noter : Au Canada 🇨🇦, Mistplay suit un modèle hybride de 2 jours/semaine en bureau à Toronto (400 University Ave) & Montréal (1001 Blvd. Robert-Bourassa) 
Mistplay is the #1 loyalty app for mobile gamers. Our community of millions of engaged mobile gamers come to Mistplay to discover new games to play and earn rewards. Gamers are rewarded for their time and money spent within the games and can redeem those rewards for gift cards. Mistplay is on a mission to be the best way to play mobile games for everyone everywhere! Download Mistplay on the Google Play Store here and follow us on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook.
📍 Please Note: In Canada 🇨🇦, Mistplay follows a 2 days/week in-office hybrid model in Toronto (400 University Ave) & Montreal (1001 Blvd. Robert-Bourassa) 
Senior Manager, Analytics & Experimentation
What You'll Do at Mistplay:
•Set team or department goals and align them with company strategy.
•Use stakeholder priorities and roadmap as input to planning and devise clear key results.
•Mentor and coach direct reports while actively sharing feedback and managing their performance and growth.
•Lead end-to-end analytics projects, including deep dives into core product funnels, experiment design, and the development of decision models.
•Own the delivery of analytics outcomes and ensure the team strives to drive the business rather than operating as a support team.
•Partner with cross-functional leaders to define and continuously align priorities with business stakeholders.
•Advocate for tools, resourcing, and process improvements.
•Represent the team or function in leadership forums.
•Foster an inclusive and growth-oriented team culture.
•Contribute to the development of an experimentation-driven culture by sharing learnings and recommendations from experiments with key stakeholders.
What You'll Bring to Mistplay:
•8+ years of experience in product analytics or data science, including 3-5 years of people management.
•Bachelor's degree required; Master's or MBA in a quantitative field such as Computer Science, Statistics, or Economics is preferred.
•Advanced expertise in analytics and experimentation, including A/B testing, multivariate testing, statistical analysis, and experiment design.
•Strong technical acumen in data modeling, SQL, and data pipeline management.
•Proficiency with BI platforms such as Tableau, Looker, or Power BI for dashboarding and data visualization.
•Deep foundational knowledge of core inferential statistics concepts such as significance, power, confidence intervals, and variance.
•Experience with experimentation platforms like Optimizely or Statsig.
•Skills in data analysis languages including Python.
•Familiarity with data warehouses such as Databricks.
•Pro-level ability to synthesize and communicate complex concepts and analyses in simple ways to both technical and non-technical audiences.
•Proven ability in stakeholder management, cross-functional leadership, and driving business outcomes with a solution-oriented mindset.
Gestionnaire Senior,  Analyse et Expérimentation
Ce que vous ferez chez Mistplay :
•Établir des objectifs d'équipe ou de département et les aligner avec la stratégie de l'entreprise.
•Utiliser les priorités des parties prenantes et la feuille de route comme intrants pour la planification et concevoir des résultats clés clairs.
•Encadrer et coacher les subordonnés directs tout en partageant activement des commentaires et en gérant leur performance et leur croissance.
•Diriger des projets d'analyse de bout en bout, y compris des analyses approfondies des entonnoirs de produits de base, la conception d'expériences et le développement de modèles de décision.
•Assumer la responsabilité de la livraison des résultats d'analyse et s'assurer que l'équipe s'efforce de faire progresser l'entreprise plutôt que d'agir comme une équipe de soutien.
•Travailler en partenariat avec les leaders interfonctionnels pour définir et aligner continuellement les priorités avec les parties prenantes de l'entreprise.
•Plaider pour les outils, les ressources et les améliorations de processus.
•Représenter l'équipe ou la fonction dans les forums de leadership.
•Favoriser une culture d'équipe inclusive et axée sur la croissance.
•Contribuer au développement d'une culture axée sur l'expérimentation en partageant les apprentissages et les recommandations des expériences avec les parties prenantes clés.
Ce que vous apporterez à Mistplay :
•8 ans et plus d'expérience en analyse de produit ou en science des données, incluant 3 à 5 ans de gestion de personnel.
•Baccalauréat requis; une maîtrise ou un MBA dans un domaine quantitatif tel que l'informatique, les statistiques ou l'économie est préférable.
•Expertise avancée en analyse et expérimentation, y compris les tests A/B, les tests multivariés, l'analyse statistique et la conception d'expériences.
•Solide sens technique en modélisation de données, SQL et gestion de pipelines de données.
•Maîtrise des plateformes d'intelligence d'affaires (BI) telles que Tableau, Looker ou Power BI pour le tableau de bord et la visualisation de données.
•Connaissance fondamentale approfondie des concepts de statistiques inférentielles de base tels que la signification (significance), la puissance, les intervalles de confiance et la variance.
•Expérience avec des plateformes d'expérimentation comme Optimizely ou Statsig.
•Compétences dans les langages d'analyse de données, notamment Python.
•Familiarité avec les entrepôts de données (data warehouses) tels que Databricks.
•Capacité de niveau professionnel à synthétiser et à communiquer des concepts et des analyses complexes de manière simple à des publics techniques et non techniques.
•Capacité éprouvée en gestion des parties prenantes, en leadership interfonctionnel et en obtention de résultats commerciaux avec un état d'esprit axé sur les solutions.
*Nous remercions tous(tes) les candidat(e)s. Le genre masculin a été utilisé dans le but d'alléger le texte. Nous souscrivons au principe de l’équité en matière d’emploi.
Pourquoi choisir Mistplay ?
Nous faisons tout pour rendre notre environnement de travail aussi accueillant et plaisant que possible ! Un poste chez Mistplay s’accompagne de toute une série d'avantages que nous proposons en mode virtuel ou présentiel : déjeuners d'équipe, soirées jeux, événements à l'échelle de l'entreprise, et bien plus encore.
Notre culture est profondément ancrée dans la croissance et soutenue par une équipe de personnes intelligentes, dynamiques et enthousiastes. Nous utilisons les données pour apprendre, améliorer et adapter en permanence. Nous favorisons un environnement dans lequel chacun est encouragé à partager ses idées, à repousser les limites, à prendre des risques calculés et à voir ses visions se concrétiser.
Why Mistplay?
We strive to make our work environment as inviting and fun as possible! Working at Mistplay is coupled with a whole array of perks that we've adopted virtually and in-person: Team Lunches, game nights, company-wide events, and so much more. Our culture is deeply rooted in growth and upheld by a team of smart, dynamic, and enthusiastic people. We utilize data to constantly learn, improve, and adapt. We foster an environment where everyone is encouraged to share their ideas, push boundaries, take calculated risks, and witness their visions come to life.

Job Description:
Department Overview
Within Business Banking, the Fund My Business (FMB) Journey is focused on delivering competitive
lending solutions with speed and simplicity to meet the evolving credit needs of our customers. By
aligning technology, process, policies, and customer experience, Fund My Business aims to elevate both
colleague and client interactions while enabling seamless credit monitoring, decisioning, and operational efficiency. The Leverage Data as a Strategic Asset team uses predictive models and analytics that generate insights leading to process efficiency and enhanced risk management.
Job Description
Are you excited about the opportunity to improve the customer and colleague experience by delivering
value faster across the credit process? Are you interested in data analytics and learning how data can be transformed into actionable insights to improve process speed, consistency and accuracy?
Working closely with cross-functional teams, this role will support planning, managing,
and executing on the end-to-end delivery and management of data and analytics programs with the objective of delivering value faster across all segments and reducing the overall effort across the credit journey, while maintaining sound risk management and compliance.
Accountabilities
Lead and support discovery, planning, business casing, and delivery of analytics and automation that simplify branch work, enhance efficiency, and improve the credit journey.
Facilitate and lead cross‑functional working sessions, driving alignment and momentum on assigned initiatives.
Collaborate across business segments to expand the use of data and analytics, improving process effectiveness and decision quality.
Develop reporting and insights that enable program monitoring, strengthen understanding, and inform continuous improvement.
Serve as a subject matter expert on Business Banking credit products, processes, and policies, with emphasis on Commercial Credit.
Act as business lead or support for model monitoring attestations, annual reviews, validations, and recalibrations to ensure model performance and compliance.
Champion analytics change and adoption, working closely with Communications and Change Management to ensure impacts are well understood, managed, and communicated.
Integrate data‑driven insights into business processes, colleague tools, and customer engagement strategies.
Drive strong cross‑functional partnership to secure buy‑in and ensure successful implementation of analytics initiatives.
Identify and escalate key issues to appropriate stakeholders in a timely and transparent manner.
Promote a culture of strong risk management and control, aligned to TD’s risk appetite and operational standards.
Contribute to a positive, high‑performing team environment, sharing knowledge, best practices, and supporting peer development.
Required Skills
Strong interpersonal, communication, and stakeholder‑management skills.
Demonstrated business acumen with the ability to identify where data and analytics can unlock efficiency, innovation, and value.
Strong math and statistics capability with the ability to understand and navigate complex processes.
Ability to translate technical insights into clear, actionable narratives for business stakeholders.
Advanced communication and storytelling skills to simplify complex data for non‑technical audiences.
Developing leadership capabilities with the ability to work effectively across all organizational levels.
Strong written and verbal communication skills, including presenting, business casing, and influencing senior leaders.
Ability to perform data analysis, synthesize insights, and present strategic recommendations.
Preferred: Small Business or Commercial Banking experience.
Preferred: Project management experience.
Experience & Education
3+ years of experience in Business Banking; experience in Commercial Credit is considered an asset.
Undergraduate degree in Business, Data Science, Analytics, Economics, Engineering, or related discipline; graduate degree or relevant certifications considered an asset.
Strong influencing skills with proven ability to make recommendations and engage stakeholders to achieve business objectives.
Strategic mindset with the ability to recommend and assess end‑to‑end process improvements.
Excellent facilitation, presentation, and negotiation skills.
Self‑starter with strong initiative, ability to work independently, and exceptional attention to detail.
Ability to connect initiatives to objectives and key results and support outcome‑driven execution.
Who We Are:
TD is one of the world's leading global financial institutions and is the fifth largest bank in North America by branches/stores. Every day, we deliver legendary customer experiences to over 27 million households and businesses in Canada, the United States and around the world. More than 95,000 TD colleagues bring their skills, talent, and creativity to the Bank, those we serve, and the economies we support. We are guided by our vision to Be the Better Bank and our purpose to enrich the lives of our customers, communities and colleagues.
TD is deeply committed to being a leader in customer experience, that is why we believe that all colleagues, no matter where they work, are customer facing. As we build our business and deliver on our strategy, we are innovating to enhance the customer experience and build capabilities to shape the future of banking. Whether you’ve got years of banking experience or are just starting your career in financial services, we can help you realize your potential. Through regular leadership and development conversations to mentorship and training programs, we’re here to support you towards your goals. As an organization, we keep growing – and so will you.
Our Total Rewards Package
Our Total Rewards package reflects the investments we make in our colleagues to help them and their families achieve their financial, physical, and mental well-being goals. Total Rewards at TD includes a base salary, variable compensation, and several other key plans such as health and well-being benefits, savings and retirement programs, paid time off, banking benefits and discounts, career development, and reward and recognition programs. Learn more
Additional Information:
We’re delighted that you’re considering building a career with TD. Through regular development conversations, training programs, and a competitive benefits plan, we’re committed to providing the support our colleagues need to thrive both at work and at home.

You’ll have regular career, development, and performance conversations with your manager, as well as access to an online learning platform and a variety of mentoring programs to help you unlock future opportunities. Whether you have a passion for helping customers and want to expand your experience, or you want to coach and inspire your colleagues, there are many different career paths within our organization at TD – and we’re committed to helping you identify opportunities that support your goals.
Training & Onboarding
We will provide training and onboarding sessions to ensure that you’ve got everything you need to succeed in your new role.
Interview Process

Accommodation 
Your accessibility is important to us. Please let us know if you’d like accommodations (including accessible meeting rooms, captioning for virtual interviews, etc.) to help us remove barriers so that you can participate throughout the interview process.
We look forward to hearing from you!

Department Overview
Building a World-Class, Diverse and Inclusive Technology Team at TD
We can't afford to be boring. Neither can you. The scale and scope of what TD does may surprise you. The rapid pace of change makes it a business imperative for us to be smart and open-minded in the way we think about technology. TD's technology and business teams become more intertwined as new opportunities present themselves. This new era in banking does not equal boring. Not at TD, anyway.
TD Regulatory, Audit & Compliance Assurance is home to a team of highly valued professionals, who support all Platform & Technology (P&T) related Regulatory and support interactions, which includes business, 2nd, or 3rd LOD led exams. They provide oversight and governance, independently challenging High / Med severity issues tied to Regulatory, Audit and ORM. Includes issue escalations tied to potential overdue and validation failures, issue support for insight, governance reporting and exams. Also, provides demand management support assurance functions.
There's room to grow in all of it.
Job Specific Accountabilities
The Business Management Specialist – Data & Analytics role is to support its Platforms & Technology Global Security & Defense division in Canada or the United States. This role focuses on leveraging audit and regulatory findings data to drive advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and data-driven decision-making to enhance risk management and compliance.
Data Strategy & Leadership:
This role will be central to strengthening our risk management framework, ensuring findings are analysed with rigor, and enabling leaders to make data driven decisions that enhance compliance, control effectiveness, and sustainability of remediation. Here's some of what you may be asked to perform:
Partner with the Data Manager to define and execute the Assurance Governance Oversight data strategy.
Lead the design and implementation of advanced analytics solutions aligned to business priorities.
Mentor and guide junior data scientists and analysts, fostering a culture of analytical excellence.
Data Science & Risk Analytics:
Design, build, and deploy statistical and machine learning models to identify patterns, risk concentrations, and trends within audit and regulatory findings.
Develop predictive analytics to forecast emerging risks, remediation delays, or control failures.
Establish quantitative methods for severity scoring, risk-weighting, and prioritization of findings.
Audit & Regulatory Data Analysis:
Analyze large volumes of findings and remediation data to generate actionable insights for risk committees, regulatory forums, and executive leadership.
Job Description:
 The role centers on leveraging audit and regulatory findings data to drive advanced analytics, predictive modeling, and data-driven decision-making to strengthen risk management and compliance in the Platforms & Technology Global Security & Defense division in Canada
Perform root cause analysis across findings to identify systemic issues and control design weaknesses.
Support sustainability assessments of remediated findings through data-driven testing and metrics.
Develop and deploy statistical, machine learning and AI models to solve complex business problems and modernization initiatives
Perform exploratory and predictive analytics to identify trends, risks and opportunities
Ensure model interpretability, governance, and alignment with ethical and regulatory standards
Risk Reporting & Governance:
The role develops dashboards, scorecards, and executive-level reporting that translate complex findings data into meaningful risk intelligence, and collaborates with GRC teams to bolster reporting for regulators and internal oversight, ensuring alignment with regulatory and risk frameworks
Collaborate with GRC (Governance, Risk & Compliance) teams across the 3 lines of defense areas to strengthen reporting for regulators, auditors, and internal oversight bodies.
Ensure all analytics and reporting adhere to regulatory expectations, NIST/ISO frameworks, and risk governance standards.
Conduct deep-dive analysis and deliver insights through clear, executive-ready dashboards, reports and presentations
Create complex and comprehensive BI reporting packages and dashboards utilizing data infrastructure, localized datamarts and external data sources
Transform complex findings into actionable recommendations that drive measurable outcomes
Build and maintain KPIs and metrics that monitor performance, risk , and operational health.
Data Management & Innovation:
Collaborate with applicable corporate partners to optimize data pipelines, metadata management, and data quality for findings repositories.
Automate recurring analysis and reporting processes to increase efficiency and accuracy.
Introduce advanced AI/ML techniques (e.g., NLP for findings categorization, clustering for thematic risks) to modernize insights delivery.
Leverage modern tools and platforms (e.g. Python, SQL, Power BI, Co-Pilot AI, etc) for scalable data analysis
Contribute to automation and innovation in data processing, analytics, and visualization
Technical Skills And Risks & Governance Expertise:
An undergraduate degree or technical certificate is required, and certifications such as CRISC / CISA as well as experience in information security, cyber security, technology risk
Advanced proficiency in Python, R, SQL; familiarity with big data and cloud platforms (Spark, AWS, Azure, GOP).
Experience with machine learning, predictive analytics, and statistical modeling applied to risk or audit data
Expertise in data visualization and storytelling using Power BI, Tableau or equivalent.
Knowledge of audit methodologies, regulatory frameworks (e.g., OCC, Fed, Basel, SOX, NIST, ISO 27001), and issue management practices
Proficiency in Atlassian Confluence, including a strong understanding of spaces, templates, macros, and permissions. Develop web applications and user interfaces using React, HTML, and CSS, ensuring a responsive and seamless user experience. Integrate Confluence with other Atlassian products and third-party applications as needed for seamless workflow.
Knowledgeable in Artificial Intelligence to lead the design, development and deployment of AI-driven solutions that enhance business operations, decision-making, and innovation.
Experience with GRC platforms (e.g., Archer, Serivce Now, MetricStream) a strong plus
Understanding of risk taxonomies, KRIs and control effectiveness measures.
Risk Mindset: Anticipates and quantifies risks to support proactive mitigation.
Data Storytelling: Translates technical analysis into clear, concise narratives for executives and regulators.
Works autonomously as a senior/lead on a diverse range of tasks and is relied upon to coach/ educate others
Stay current with the latest research and trends in AI/ML and recommend relevant tools, frameworks and methodologies.
Specific Educational Requirements / Accreditations:
An undergraduate degree or technical certificate is required, and certifications such as CRISC / CISA as well as experience in information security, cyber security, technology risk
7+ years data science and analytics experience
CRISC certification or equivalent experience a plus.
CISA certification or equivalent experience a plus.
CISSP certification or equivalent experience a plus.
Information Security or technology risk and controls background, Big Four experience a plus
AI/ML tools knowledge / experience

Toronto, Ontario, Canada
